texts.en: Dorcus is 28 years old and lives in Congo town, Liberia. She is married and has five children between the ages 7 and 10; three of them attend school. For the past five years, Dorcus has been selling frozen chicken and pig feet. She started out her business with 5,000 Liberian dollars. She is now requesting a loan to purchase two cartons of frozen chicken and pig feet. She plans to buy a land and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cartons of frozen chicken and pig feet

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 29 years old, married to James and blessed with three children. She has a transport business and a gym that she has been running for four years. She earns a monthly income of about 20,000 KES which she uses to take care of her family and pump back into her business.

Florence is being loaned 80,000 KES, her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the loan to purchase modern equipment for her gym.

Florence plans to use the anticipated profits to purchase another matatu (vehicle) and pay for her children’s higher education. In the future, she hopes to purchase a plot of land and develop it.

loans.use: to purchase modern equipment for her gym.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cartons of milk and candles to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 51 years old from Vihiga and is married to Miriam. They have two children who are in primary school.

Thomas has a livestock business that he has been operating for the past ten years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. He intends to use the loan to buy three cows to add to his herd.

The anticipated profits from this business will be used to pay for the family's needs and school fees for his children. He intends to see his business expand and be able to open a butcher shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy three cows to add to his herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items like sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fifty bags of Charcoal for her business

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 31 years old and married to Boswell. They have two school-going children.

Lillian has a retail shop that she has been running for the past eight years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd and intends to use the money to buy more sugar, tea leaves, baking flour, soft drinks to build up her inventory. 

The anticipated profits will be used to cater to the family's needs, and also invest back into the business.

She hopes to be able to open her own wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, tea leaves, baking flour, soft drinks to add to her stock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She has been tailoring for seven years to earn a living. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. Susan joined Faulu Kenya so that she could get loans easily. She used her previous loan to boost her business. She hopes to grow her business and increase her clientele. 

Susan has requested 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric, an overlock machine, and curtain tape.

loans.use: To buy fabric, an overlock machine, and curtain tape

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 33 years old, married to Hillary, and has three children who are in primary school. They live in Vihiga. 

She has a nursery school that she has been running for the past eight years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a friend. She intends to use the loan build another classroom to expand the school. 

She hopes to be able to build a primary school in the future.

loans.use: To build a classroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase knitting supplies like materials, different colors of threads, laces, designs, etc.

loans.name: Emmelia

texts.en: Emelia has two years in the business of selling fruits like soft drink, mangoes and pineapple. she request a loan from BRAC south sudan to expand her business. She is 37 years old and married with a husband who is businessman. She has five children; three of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: She want more income to able her purchase more fruits likes mangoes pineapples for sale

loans.name: Jasto

texts.en:
Jasto is 50 years old. He is from the Boyani area in Vihiga, and is married to Dinah Mdambo. They have three children who are in high school.

Jasto has a livestock business that he has been running for the past two years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more goats to add to his current stock. 

He will use the anticipated profits he makes to cater to his family's needs and pay school fees for his children.

His future desire is to diversify into the poultry business.

loans.use: To buy more goats to add to his stock.

loans.name: Benediction Ii Group

texts.fr: BENEDICTION II est un groupement de quatorze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Françoise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Françoise a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Françoise est une couturière qui confectionne des tenues à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d’année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Françoise vend des produits vivriers (maïs, etc.). Françoise s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupement BENEDICTION II. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Benediction II is a 14-people group, whose members all reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Francoise (who is raising her hand in the picture) is 40 years old; she is married to a shopkeeper named Vincent. The couple has three children, who all go to school. In addition to their children, the couple supports another child. Francoise and her husband live together with their children and take care of them together. Francoise left school in middle school.
Francoise is a seamstress who has been sewing outfits from her home for about twenty years. She also sells produce (corn, etc.) She gets her supplies in Benin.
Looking for customer satisfaction, Francoise is requesting a first loan with the members of the Benediction II group. This loan will be used to better meet customers' expectations and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items and corn.

loans.name: Rofina

texts.en: Rofina is 34 years old, married to Samuel (who is an insurance man), and they have three children. They live in Vihiga. Rofina has a retail shop that she has been running for the past 10 years. She is applying for her sixth loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully completing the previous ones. She will use the money to buy cooking oil, baking flour, soft drinks, sugar, tea leaves, etc., to add to her stock. The anticipated profits from her business will help her pay school fees for her children and also save for her business. Her future hope and dream is to be able to establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy baking flour, tea leaves, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, eddoes and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 48 ans, mariez et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 22 et 24 ans. Pour palier aux difficultés de sa famille et supporter les etudes de ses enfants , elle se lance dans la fabrique des beignets , son activité se déroule chez elle a domicile, ses ventes sont de 10.000 a 25.000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt elle va renforcer son commerce en achetant deux sacs de farines, 1 sac de sucre de 50 kg de sucre, 2 bidons de 25 l d'huile, du sel , de la levure chimique 1 sac de 50kg de riz et 25 kg de lait.

A l'avenir , elle veut ouvrir une pâtisserie pour fabriquer différents gâteaux comme les brioches et cakes faire la livraison en gros et ouvrir d'autres coins de livraison comme dans les écoles, les marches et trouver des jeunes desoeuvres qui vont travailler avec elle.
texts.en:
This client is 48 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of 22 and 24. To overcome her family's difficulties and support her children's education, she started making and selling beignets. She runs her business at home, and her sales vary between 10,000 and 25,000 Fr per day.

After being granted her loan, she is going to strengthen her business by buying two bags of flour, one 50kg bag of sugar, two 25L cans of oil, salt, baking powder, one 50kg bag of rice, and 25kg of milk.

In the future, she wants to open a pastry shop to make various types of cakes such as brioches and fruitcakes, to deliver in bulk and open other outlets in places like schools and markets, and finally to find young people who are currently unemployed and willing to work for her.

loans.use: To buy 50kg bags of flour, 50kg of sugar, 25L cans of oil, baking powder, and a packet of vanilla sugar.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Mustafa has a grocery business selling food.  He has had this business for 1 year.         

To help expand his business, Mustafa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda.  He will use the loan to purchase food for resale.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees.  In the future, he hopes to be able to complete his rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma's main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 27 years old, is married, and has 2 grown children. She has had her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly.

Herma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets to raise and pig feed.

In the future, Herma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.en:
Mahabat is a 44-year-old villager. She lives in the village of Kyzylbulak, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She works in the local administration of a nearby area and is characterized by her colleagues as a very positive and open-hearted person. Currently, her salary is too low to support her family, which is why she began to breed livestock and cultivate the land.

Mahabat began her business using 6,000 Kyrgyzstani som (KGS) in capital and, over time, managed to generate a profit of 3,000 KGS per month. She was able to establish a farm, which is in need of development. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenue she expects to generate from the loan, she plans to expand her business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the area's especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which in turn leads to increased employment and meets the needs of clients and lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 40 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are currently in school.  He has had a hardware business for 4 years.  He also has two other businesses, in farming and spare parts.

Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda to help expand his business.  He will use the loan to purchase hardware goods for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees.  In the future, he hopes to expand his hardware business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware goods for resale.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
To make a living, Madeline owns and operates a business venture selling rice and vegetables. Madeline is married and has four school-aged children. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Madeline joined Kiva's partner ASKI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madeline is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of rice and different kinds of vegetables to sell. In the future, Madeline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her selling activity.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. Mary has a business selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Josephat Kibaya

texts.en:
50 year old Josephat is a coffee farmer in Bushenyi in western Uganda. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. Before that, this happily married father of five was mostly doing odd jobs in Bushenyi Town. Farming has extricated him out of his adversity, and for that reason he devotes most of his time planning how his business can gain stronger ground. 

The fact that coffee sells highly on the markets in western Uganda has been giving him further motivation to work hard at establishing a bigger niche. Proceeds from his coffee sales have been used to purchase high grade manure for his farms. Weekly his coffee sales profits total 450,000 Ugandan shillings (~$180), quite a substantial amount of money by Ugandan standards. 

Josephat says with this Kiva loan, he will be empowered to purchase more high grade manure for his coffee farms. He says he does not have much manure at present. Over time he anticipates better coffee yields. Depending on the stability of coffee prices on the local and international markets, better yields will mean better sales profits for him.

loans.use: to buy better and high grade manure for use on his coffee farms.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 51 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is widowed and has 3 children.  None of his children is currently in school.  Christopher has a grocery business where he sells food. He has had this business for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Christopher has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christopher hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, Christopher hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with 4 adult-aged children. She is 55 years old and she has a retail shop where she can sell a variety of products in the community. Margarita has had this business for 3 years and she earns approximately 6,000 PHP (~$142) monthly.

Margarita is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell.

In the future, Margarita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her selling activity.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en:
Sharafat lives in Saatli. He is married and the father of three children.  He has been running a business of selling construction materials, such as cement and fuels, for more than three years. He makes his sales from his own house, which allows him to have many clients and customers while at the same time be engaged in a cattle-raising business together with his wife. Currently he is asking for a 1,100 AZN loan to purchase young cattle. He has five years of experience in cattle breeding. 

Being a very accurate person by nature, he is sure, and would like to ensure the lenders, that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations.

loans.use: to purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a business that sells clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jouanis

texts.en:
Jouanis is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school. She has a business of selling timber, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Jouanis has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Menecia

texts.en:
Menecia's main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married, and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Santa Cruz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP (~$166) monthly.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Menecia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feed and breeding livestock. 

In the future, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and breeding livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three young cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Fidélia

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Fidélia est mariée et mère d’ 01 enfant. Elle a une passion rendre belle toute personne. Depuis 2002 elle a ouvert son atelier. Elle vend des pagnes.  Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui servira à acheter des marchandises pour coudre afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a une ambition : devenir une couturière de renom.
texts.en: A dress designer by profession, Fidélia is married and has one child. Her passion is to make everyone look beautiful. In 2002, she opened her own workshop. She sells pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing). This loan that she is seeking will serve to buy merchandise to sew in order to satisfy her customers. She has one ambition: to become a well-known designer.

loans.use: To buy and sew pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is married with 4 school-aged children. She has a food stall where she sells rice. Sherlita has had this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale in the community. She usually earns about 2,500 PHP (~$62) each month in this business.

In the future, Sherlita hopes that her business will improve so that she can pay for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new types of mobile phones

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou agee de 54 ans habite un village situe a environ 15 km de la ville principale.Elle est mariee et mere de 7 enfants dont l'aine a 32 ans et le plus jeune,18.
Fatou est  dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans deja.Elle l'a herite en quelque sorte de sa mere adoptive.IL faut aussi noter que Fatou n' est pas novice dans les credits car elle a eu a  en benefier de 3 auparavent.
Avec ce credit elle veut acheter des produits halieutiques(poissons fumes,yet...)
Cette operation lui permettra d'augmenter son profit afin de mieux gerer les depenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou is 54 years old and lives in a town located about 15km from the main city. She is married and has seven children, of whom the eldest is 32 and the youngest is 18.
Fatou has been in business for over 15 years already. She inherited it in some sense from her adoptive mother. It is also worth noting that Fatou is no stranger to repaying loans, as she has benefited from three already.
With this loan, she wants to buy seafood products (smoked fish, dried cymbium molluscs, etc.).
This operation will allow her to increase her profits in order to better manage her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy seafood products (smoked fish, dried cymbium molluscs, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a range of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. She has been in this business of selling fruits like tomatoes, mangoes and pineapple soft drinks for two years.

She request a loan  from BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She has eight children. seven of whom are in school, with the extra profits from her loan.she will be able to pay the school fees of her children and build a new house.

loans.use: She want more income to able her purchase more tomatoes,pineaple for sale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde esta casada con el señor Luciano desde hace 28 años con quien tiene tres hijos.
En el año 1996 Doña Matilde decidió abrir su propio taller de confecciones con la ayuda de su marido, que es funcionario policial.
Ella en la actualidad ella fabrica uniformes a los militares y policias gracias a los lasos de amistad que tiene su marido Luciano y gracias a esto ella ya tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre recurren a ella.
Doña Matilde posee dos  maquinas de coser de tipo industrial, pero le gustaría poder seguir con la ampliación de su microempresa, agregando mas maquinas de coser ya que posee una gran demanda.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de maquinas de coser, como así también de los insumos que va a necesitar para la confección de las prendas.
texts.en:
Señora Matilde has been married to Señor Luciano for 28 years; they have three children.

In 1996 with help from her husband, who is a civil servant with the police department, Sra. Matilde decided to open her own sewing workshop. She currently makes uniforms for the military and the police because of the friendly connections that her husband has with them.  As a result, Matilde has a lot of customers who always come back to her.

She already owns industrial sewing machines but would like to continue expanding her business by adding more sewing machines since there is a lot of demand for her work. 

Matilde is seeking a loan to buy sewing machines and also the other supplies she is going to need to make clothing.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and other supplies for her clothing business

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou  est agée de 44 ans .Elle a 4  jeunes enfants .Elle habite  dans un village situé à 15 km de la ville principale. 
Astou est vendeuse de légumes et de mangues depuis  plus  de 10 ans .Elle a appris le métier par sa mère qui était aussi vendeuse.
Avec ce crédit  elle veut acheter des légumes :choux,aubergine, carottes
Avec le financement elle pourra augmenter son fond de roulement et régler les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Astou is 44 years old. She has four young children. She lives in a village located 10 miles from the main city.
Astou has been retailing vegetables and mangoes for over ten years. She learned the trade from her mother, who also was a saleswoman.
With this loan, she wants to purchase vegetables: cabbage, eggplants and carrots.
With the financing, she will be able to increase her working capital and to pay her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for retail (cabbage, eggplants, carrots...)

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is 33 years old, married and has two children.  

She makes and sells detergents to earn a living. She has been operating the business for three years. Besides making detergents, she gets extra income from farming.  

She was previously selling second-hand clothes. She has boosted her business with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya. 

Juliah hopes to buy a business premise instead of renting in the future. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy chemicals for making soap and containers for storing it.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for making soap and containers for storing it.

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has eight children and seven go to school, 

She is currently in the business of selling dried fish. Now she wants to purchase more fish to sell.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Duke is 29 years old and married with two children. 

He runs a pharmacy to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people. He has become hopeful in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He has also managed to improve his lifestyle because his business has grown.
  
Duke hopes to become a successful businessman in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy a photocopy machine for use in his business.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine for use in his business.

loans.name: Franciska

texts.en:
She is 41 years old and married. She has four children and three of whom are in school.

She has been in this business of selling g_nut paste for one year. She took a loan through BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.  With the extra profits from her loan, she will be able to pay school fee for her children.

loans.use: selling  g_nut paste

loans.name: Ndeye Mareme

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme âgée de 36 ans.Elle est divorcée et vit avec un enfant.Elle avait entamée une formation en couture qu'elle a arrêtée faute de pouvoir payer ses frais de scolarité. Elle s'est alors engagée dans le commerce de produits vestimentaires et cosmétiques. Elle s'approvisionne à l'extérieur dans un pays limitrophe et revend ses produits dans sa localité. Son activité lui permet de prendre en charge ses besoins alimentaires, de santé, vestimentaires ainsi que ceux de son enfant. Elle n'a jamais sollicité de crédit à l'IMCEC. Le montant de 100 000F qu'elle sollicite en ce moment lui permettra d'acheter 2 cartons de parfum, 2 cartons de crème, 1 basin de 30m, 2 tissu maylouss. Ces achats vont renforcer son stock et lui permettre d'accroitre ses bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices, elle pourra vivre dans de meilleurs conditions, elle et son enfant.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young woman, 36 years of age. She is divorced and lives with one child. She had started training in sewing but stopped it since she could not pay her tuition. She then involved herself in the retail of clothing and cosmetics.
She gets her supplies from a neighboring country, and resells these items in her town. Her activity allows her to support herself and her child for their food, healthcare and clothing needs. She never requested a loan from IMCEC before. The 100,000 XOF amount she is now requesting will make it possible for her to purchase two boxes of perfumes, two boxes of lotion, 30 meters of brocade cloth and two "maylouss" garments.
These purchases will strengthen her stock and allow her to increase her profits. With these, she and her child will be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dozen perfumes, two dozen body lotions, 30 meters of boubous (fabric) and two ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more young coffee and banana plants to grow on her farms.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 29 years old, married and has two children. 

She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been operating the business for two years with two employees. Apart from owning the salon, she sells second-hand clothes for extra income.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business. As a result, she has become financially stable.
  
Faith aspires to become a great entrepreneur in the future. She needs 70,000 KES to buy chairs and a steaming machine and open a cosmetic counter.

loans.use: To buy chairs and a steaming machine and open a cosmetic counter.

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. 

She has been in this business of selling beans and rice for three years.she took loan from BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.she will use the profit for her business to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: she want more income to able her purchase more beans,rice for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 54 years old, married and has eight children.  

She has been farming for 13 years. She sells farm produce such as milk and vegetables. Besides that, she sells charcoal and firewood to earn extra income.  

Margaret attests that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business and has more income to cater to her family's needs.
  
Margaret hopes to improve her business and get enough capital to buy a piece of land. She has requested 30,000 KES to buy seeds, chemicals and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy seeds, chemicals and animal feed.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Lourdes contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 20 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6to. ciclo del programa. Todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria, de definen como mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras.
La Sra. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace ya un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una cantidad de clientes bien definida. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante, y así poder brindarle a su familia una vida decorosa. Ella se considera una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que no tiene miedo al trabajo.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de más cosméticos para poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
This excellent group of businesswomen was formed in the town of Itá. The current Chairperson Sra. Lourdes contacted the advisor in a weekly meeting that she was holding in the area to tell her about the kind of work that the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs were doing. Once the program was assessed, she managed to get together twenty women who work well together and are already in their sixth loan cycle. They are committed and supportive of each other and can be described as diligent and hardworking.

Sra. Lourdes has been selling cosmetics for some time so she has a regular clientele. Through her hard work she has managed to get ahead and provide a decent life for her family. She is considered to be a very hardworking woman who is not afraid of work. 

Lourdes is seeking a loan to buy more cosmetics so she can increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to re-sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and is married with two children between the ages of one and four years old. He owns a business of transporting people.  Emmanuel has been in this business for about one year and his business is open from 7 am until 10 pm every day. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase another motorcycle to help him in the business. With any profits, he  will reinvest in his business and save for his family's future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle to help him.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children, two of them are still attending school and the oldest is attending university. 

He has been working as a real estate broker for the past 20 years. He works hard in cooperation with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to maintain the family's financial status at a good level. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his son's university education fees. His son is studying pharmacology and this is his second year. He says that his son is very ambitious and willing to open his own pharmacy in the future to be able to help the family with living expenses.

loans.use: to pay his son's university education fees

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita. La Sra. Sandra es la actual presidenta del comité, fue gracias a ella que se unieron sus vecinas y amigas y lograron formar el comité.
El comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria. Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras y sacrificadas que día a día luchan por llevar el sustento a sus hogares.
La Sra. Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace ya varios años. Ella ha formado un grupo de clientes bien definido que la conocen muy bien. Ella dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de sus familiares para procurarles un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas ropas, en especial de invierno, ahora se viene el invierno y le gustaría tener mas variedad de ropas par vender.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita is called Oñondivepa.  Sandra is the current president of the committee, and it was thanks to her that neighbors and friends united and succeeded in forming the committee.  

The committee is in their second loan cycle.  They all work together.  They define themselves as being fighters who make sacrifices that every day they fight to bring sustenance to their homes.

Sandra has worked selling clothing for many years.  She has formed a defined group of customers who she knows very well.  She said that everything she does is for the good of her family so that she can provide them a better future.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase more clothing, especially for winter.  Winter is coming and she would like to have a larger variety of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase items of clothing like hats, jackets, and more.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. Despite his young age, he has built up good experience working in floor covering for the past eight years. 

In 2010, he decided to work independently, sticking with multiple projects in his village and its surroundings. He has a good number of clients asking for his services. Today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools to continue the expansion of his business and  further increase his productivity. He feels positive about his business' potentiA. in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to expand his business and increase his productivity

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es:
A sus 62 años de edad Jose Diego se siente orgulloso de su negocio, el cual ha sacado adelante con esmero y dedicación, desde hace varios años Jose tiene un kiosco ubicado en el parque de Caldas, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia donde es reconocido por sus clientes, gracias a la buena atención que les brinda y la variedad de productos que les ofrece.

Sin embargo Jose Diego es conciente que para mejorar el servicio que ofrece deberá mejorar su lugar de trabajo y para esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar una nevera que le hace falta para mantener en buen estado sus productos, igualmente necesita surtir su negocio con nuevos productos para seguir posicionando su negocio y con sus ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
At 62 years old, Jose Diego is proud of his business, which he has improved with care and dedication.  For many years, Jose has had a kiosk located in the Caldas park, a municipality in the Antioquia department where he is recognized by his customers thanks to the good service he has given them and the variety of products he offers.

However, Jose Diego knows that in order to improve the service he offers, he should improve his place of work.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan to purchase a refrigerator that he needs to keep his products fresh.  He also needs to stock his store with new products to continue positioning his business and improve his quality of life with his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and stock for his store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old, married and has three children.  

She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money. This has helped her to invest more in her business. She hopes to invest in other businesses in the future. She sees herself owning a boutique in five years.

Ruth has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ayeso

texts.en:
Ayeso now has a grocery store where she sells goods such as groundnuts, rice, and flour. She took a loan through BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. 

Ayeso is married. She is 23 years old and has four children, two of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: she want more income to able her purchase more rice, ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es: Claudia Azucena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con fondos propios con el objetivo de buscar apoyo con los gastos del hogar. Pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha podido sacar adelante su medio de vida. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido importante para mantener 2 hijos a su cargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y toallas. Sueña con aumentar su negocio y mejorar cada día más el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en: Claudia Azucena has a business selling general merchandise.  She started the business with her own funds because she was looking for a way to help with the household expenses. But over time she has been able to make progress with her business.  She has been doing this work for more than 12 years, and it has been an important means of support for the two children in her care.  The loan that she requests will be used to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, bed sheets and towels.  She dreams of expanding her business and providing better service each day to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, bed sheets and towels

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia nació en la ciudad de Huarocondo de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 52 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos.

Actualmente, la socia vive en la ciudad de donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos y cuyes. Ella en los días festivos se dedica a la preparación de chicharrón y lechón (Estos platos típicos de la zona se preparan con la carne de chancho en las fiestas patronales). Ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donde vende chicha de jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado ósea un ternerito.
texts.en:
Florentina is a hardworking and responsible person.  Because of these qualities, she was invited by friends to join the communal bank  “Las Natividades” in the Asociación Arariwa.

Florentina was born in the city of Huarocondo in the Anta province of the department of Cusco, Peru.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children.

Now she lives in the city where she was born, and there she has developed her commercial activities.  Florentina has a business raising small animals, such as pigs and guinea pigs.  On festival days she prepares chicharrón and lechón (these are both traditional Peruvian pork dishes that are often consumed during the Patron Saint festivals.)  She has a small stand that she operates from her house where she sells chicha de jora (a traditional Peruvian drink made from fermented corn.)  She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At this time she requests a loan to buy a young cow (calf.)

loans.use: to buy a young cow (calf)

loans.name: Trephina

texts.en:
Trephina is married to a lovely husband and she is the lone wife to the husband.  She has six children with none of them below the ages of fifteen; she has four rooms in her house with each person per room.  She lives in Aluminum which is located in the North West Region of Cameroon.

She has faced major challenges in life such as sickness, accidents and the death of her relatives, especially the death of her daughter.  Her in-laws would not let her live a peaceful life, that notwithstanding, she also has the problem of inadequate capital to start up a good business for income generation. 

She has taken and repaid loans 10 times since she joined GHAPE in the year 2002.  The amount she is requesting will be used to buy motor spare parts to add to what she already has.  She thinks she will succeed in the business because of the expertise she has gotten and the marketing techniques acquired in relation to this business venture.  Her activity will help the community since car owners will buy parts to repair their cars at cheaper rates. 

With the profit obtained from this loan she will use it to improve on her standard of living, pay tuition fees for her children and improve her family's financial problems.  She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it is easy to obtain a loan from GHAPE and with low interest rates and the period of repayment is gradual.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase of automobile spare parts

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, vive en compañía de su esposo, aun no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y refrescos, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para preparar la venta como maíz, chicharrón y quesillo, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para el negocio de María, pues dispondrá de lo necesario para continuar atendiendo a la clientela.
Su objetivo es apoyar a su esposo, brindar un buen servicio a los clientes y generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and they have no children.  She has had a business selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadorean dish based on a thick corn tortilla) and drinks for 20 years.  She works every day from 6am until 4pm.  She started this business on her own initiative.

At this time she requests a loan to invest in ingredients to make her products, such as corn, pork and cheese.  This loan will be a great help for Maria's business, because she will have the inputs she needs to continue serving her customers.  

Her goals are to help her husband, to provide good service to her customers and to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare pupusas: corn, pork  and cheese

loans.name: Esmeralda Perpetua

texts.es:
Esmeralda de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es una mujer trabajadora empeñada en salir adelante desde que se separo de su esposo con sus 3 hijos de 16, 9, 10 años decidió abrir un salón de belleza.

Comenzó hace 20 años atrás todo lo que es de bellezas antes de casarse pero desde hace 4 años que se separo  reinicio su actividad para tener mas ingresos y mantener a sus hijos. Labora sola de 10H00 am a 9H00 pm en su gabinete. Realiza corte de cabellos, tinturados y pedicure. Le dificulta en su local el tiempo que recorre sus clientes al llegar y por eso quiere ponerse su local mejor en la avenida principal para atraer mas clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas tintes, esmaltes varios y adecuar su local. En un futuro desea establecer su local en otro mejor lugar.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 43, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because originally there were many orchids there) in Guayaquil.  She is a hard working person determined to get ahead since she separated from her husband with her three children who are 16, 9 and 10 years of age.  She decided to open a beauty salon.

She started 20 years ago doing everything related to beauty before she was married but for the last four years since separating she restarted her activity to earn more income and support her children.  She works alone from 10am until 9pm in her stall.  She does haircuts, hair coloring and pedicures.

A difficulty she has is that her customers have to travel a bit to get to her so she wants to set herself up on the main road to attract more customers.  With help from the loan she wants to buy more hair coloring, various nail polishes and to equip her locale.  In the future she’d like to put her salon in a better location.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring, nail polish and to equip the locale.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Vivir con sus padres y tener que velar por su bienestar motivó a Luis Eduardo a darle vida a su propio negocio. Motivado por las ganas de salir adelante, este emprendedor decidió empezar a ofrecerle a su comunidad de aserrador, labor que se encarga de cortar madera, y mantener los campos y jardines de Sonsón, municipio de Antioquia en perfecto estado. Pero sus aspiraciones van allá pues en el futuro espera tener varias motosierras que le ayuden a mejorar el servicio y hacer crecer su negocio, logrando así mejorar sus ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida. 

Por ahora y empezando a dar los primeros pasos para cumplir sus sueño, Luis Eduardo ha ahorrado por varios meses para comprar su motosierra, sin embargo aún no es suficiente, motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo con el cual completar la totalidad del dinero y así ir construyendo paso a paso su futuro.
texts.en:
Living with his parents and having to see to their wellbeing motivated Luis Eduardoto give life to a business of his own.  Motivated by the desire to get ahead, this entrepreneur decided to start offering his community sawing services, work that involves cutting wood and maintaining the fields and gardens in Sonsón, a town in Antioquia, in perfect conditions.  However, his dreams go beyond this because in the future he’d like to own several chain saws that will help him improve service and make his business grow attaining better sales and proportionately improving his quality of life.

For now, starting to take the initial steps to make his dream come true, Luis Eduardo has saved up for several months to buy a chain saw.  However, it’s still not enough and this is why he’s asking for a loan to make up the difference in the total amount of money he needs so that he can be building his future step by step.

loans.use: to buy a chain saw.

loans.name: Katehe Twimukye Group

texts.en:
45 year old Peter has been inclined to the spirit of diligence the last 20 years.  Peter's reputation for hard work is well known and he has become a by-word for it.  Because he has been such a stickler for hard work, he now is looked upon as role model in his village in Bushenyi in Western Uganda. 

Peter enjoys every experience that relates to running his food sales business.  He sells food such as pineapples, bananas, cassava, maize and beans. He says the last 20 years have been worthwhile in every sense of the word.  As to whether he anticipates more success.  He says all bets are off.  He says by every long shot he has to establish a much bigger niche in the food markets in and around Bushenyi and the rest of Western Uganda. 

A business that he started small has blossomed into one he has banked on to provide better welfare to his family and relatives.  This is something he is so proud of.  As a result, his confidence has been in ascendancy for quite a long haul of time.  What really comes in handy is that Peter has his own farm where he grows crops such as bananas, beans, cassava, maize, sweet potatoes, pineapples, fruits and vegetables, etc.  He plans on putting up his own maize grinding mill in the near future. 

Weekly, Peter says this business generates him shillings 30,000 in sales profits.  With this kiva loan, Peter says he is going to purchase more bean and maize seeds for planting and also high grade manure to improve the yields of his farms.

loans.use: to purchase more bean and maize seeds for planting and to also get high grade manure to improve the yields of his farms.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old and has a fish selling business.  This business has been running for 2 years.  Alicia has 4 children.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Alicia sells his catch at the market.  She works hard to support her family.

Alicia has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and hooks.  She also plans to buy additional fish containers.  In the future, Alicia hopes for her family's life to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and fish containers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children ages 5 and 1.  Her husband runs a business of passenger boat transportation.

Catherine has been in the business of raising hogs for 5 years.  She plans to use her loan to buy pig feed and vitamins.  She also plans to use part of her loan to renovate their boat.

In the future, Catherine hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins and for boat renovation

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.

Actualmente, la socia vive en la ciudad de donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo chancho, cuy y ganado. Ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donde vende chicha de jora. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho para preparar chicharon pues se están acercando las festividades de la Virgen del Carmen.
texts.en:
The member is a responsible, hard working person.  Because of these qualities her fellow members invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “ Las Natividades” (Nativities) communal bank.

She was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  She is 29 years old, married and has two children.

Currently, she still lives in the city of her birth and where she carries out her commercial activities. She is a corn merchant but also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs and cattle.  She has a small snack bar at home where she sells chicha de jora (drink based on corn). She’s been in business for four years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it. 

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy pork to prepare fried pork because the feast days of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel are approaching.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: Jessica Patricia

texts.es:
Jessica de 25 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Empezó hace un tiempo por medio de su mama que también se dedica a la venta de ropa pero un día le dijo que realizara esta actividad porque le conviene y generas mas ingresos para sus estudios universitarios. Labora todos lo días junto con su hermana promocionado sus mercadería de ropa. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como ropas variadas para sus respectivas ventas. En un futuro quiere seguir en el negocio y la vez ayudar económicamente a sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Jessica, 25, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because in the beginning there were many orchids there) in Guayaquil.  She is a young entrepreneur who sells clothes.

She started some time ago thanks to her mother who also sold clothes but one day told her to go into this activity because it’s to her advantage to do so because it will generate more income for her university studies.  She works every day with her sister selling her clothing merchandise.

With help from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise like assorted clothes for her respective sales.  In the future, she’d like to stay in business to help her siblings economically.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking 28-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children aged seven, four, and three months; two are in school. He has been selling various household goods for the last three years. He wants in the next five years to have grown and stabilized by being financially stable. 

He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cooking pans, plates and tablecloths.

loans.use: To buy cooking pans, cups, plates, tablecloths

loans.name: Juana Orestila

texts.es:
Juana de 40 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 años que estudia en escuela particular y otro de 1 año. Tiene una farmacia.

Empezó hace 10 años con una liquidación como enfermera de una clínica decidió establecer su propio negocio. Labora de 6H00 am A 9H00 pm. Ella vende en su farmacia todo tipo de medicina necesaria para su clientela. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar vitrinas, recargas a celulares y pañales variedad de productos para su respectiva ventas. En un futuro quiere una copiadoras e instalar cabinas telefónicas para mayor ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana de 40 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 años que estudia en escuela particular y otro de 1 año. Tiene una farmacia.

Empezó hace 10 años con una liquidación como enfermera de una clínica decidió establecer su propio negocio. Labora de 6H00 am A 9H00 pm. Ella vende en su farmacia todo tipo de medicina necesaria para su clientela. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar vitrinas, recargas a celulares y pañales variedad de productos para su respectiva ventas. En un futuro quiere una copiadoras e instalar cabinas telefónicas para mayor ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: to buy display cases, cell phone cards and diapers.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 47 años. Es madre de 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Obtuvo este negocio desde muy joven ya que, tenía que mantener a su familia y decidió luchar, con esfuerzo propio ya que esto le ayudo para que sus hijos pudieran estudiar y aspirar por otros niveles académicos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 47 years old.  She has two children under her care.

She has been selling clothes for over 16 years.  She obtained this business when she was very young because she had to support her family.  She decided to be tenacious. It was her own effort that helped her so that her children would be able to go to school.

The loan she is requesting is for working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 26 years old. He is single and a hardworking businessman. He has been selling clothes and footwear for the last 14 years. He supplements his income by working as a caretaker. Previously, he used to sell shirts. He wants in the next five years to open up his business so that he is able to sell a variety of merchandise. His dream is to expand his business, marry, and start a family. 

He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy men's trousers for resale.

loans.use: To buy men's trousers for resale

loans.name: Juan Eric

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, la actividad la aprendió de su padre.
Por el momento se encuentra cultivando para ello solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes, esta compra le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario y poder realizar bien el trabajo, espera tener un buen invierno que le permita aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es apoyar a sus hijos a través de su trabajo diario, con el mejor interés de superación para el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living growing maize and breeding livestock. He has two children and lives with his wife. He has made his living in agriculture for 8 years and works every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm. He learned the trade from his father. 

At the moment he is farming, this is why he is requesting a loan to invest it in manure and fertilizers. This purchase will help him to have everything necessary and be able to do a good job. He hopes to have a good winter that will allow him to increase production.

His objective is to support his children through his daily work with the improvement of his family’s future and in their best interest.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hardworking 47-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two school-going children aged 12 and 10. 

She has been operating a beauty salon for the last nine years. She has managed to retain her business through the support of Faulu Kenya. She wants in the next five years to have grown her business and attained financial stability. 

She wants a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair oil, shampoo, and conditioners.

loans.use: To buy oil, shampoo, and hair conditioner

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado El Progreso se encuentra en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está conformado por 21 miembros, todas ellas vecinas y amigas de la ciudad.
El grupo de mujeres se define como mujeres jefas de familia que trabajan para el sustento diario de sus hogares. Manifiestan que todas trabajan de forma conjunta y solidaria, donde se ayudan recíprocamente dentro de un ambiente de respeto y cooperación.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años ya. Ella todos los días se levanta a tempranas horas para elaborar los alimentos que pondrá a la venta y regresa ya entrada la noche. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido sacar a su familia adelante y darles así una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende, como ser, carnes, especias, huevos, y demás.
texts.en:
The “El Progreso” (The Progress) Communal Bank is in the city of San Lorenzo.  It is comprised of 21 members; all of them are neighbors and friends from the city.

This group of women is defined as being women who are heads of the family.  They work for the daily support of their households.  They say that they all work together in a supportive way.  They help each other within an atmosphere of respect and cooperation.

Maria has been selling food for several years now.  She gets up in the early hours every day to make the food that she will sell, and she returns at night.  Through this work she has been able to get her family ahead.  She has also been able to give them a decent and respectable life.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make the food she sells.  She will buy things like meat, spices, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, eggs, and other ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marlon Anibal

texts.es:
Marlon, vive con sus padres, es soltero, no tiene hijos, pero si dos hermanos de 13 y 10 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura  junto a su padre, trabaja todos los días de la semana iniciando a las 6:00am. Por el momento están sembrando maíz con su padre pero necesitan abono y fertilizantes para fortalecer la plantación.
Él solicita un préstamo para adquirir los insumos agrícolas, que son tan necesarios para el desarrollo del maíz, con el que espera no correr el riesgo de que sus cultivos se vean dañados por plagas.
Para Marlon su propósito es apoyar a sus padres con el trabajo diario, para poder sustentar las necesidades del hogar y ayudar a sus hermanos menores.
texts.en:
Marlon lives with his parents.  He’s single and has no children but he does have two siblings who are 13 and 10 years old.  He is a farmer alongside his father.  He works every day of the week starting at 6 in the morning.  For the moment, he and his father are farming corn but they need manure and fertilizer to strengthen the crops.

He is asking for a loan to acquire farming supplies which are so very necessary for the corn’s development and that he hopes will keep him from running any risk of having his crops damaged by infestations.  For Marlon, his goal is to support his parents with daily work to meet household expenses and help his younger siblings.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: G.s. Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Sagrada Familia está conformado por Aurora y Amparo y Aurora Elena. Aurora de 61 se dedica a una pulpería, tiene más de 27 años de tener este negocio inicio con muy pocos productos, es así que ha mejorado cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, leche, huevos, sopas, pan, jugos entre otros. Sueña con mejorar cada día y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: The "Sagrada Familia"  (Holy Family) communal bank's members are Aurora, Amparo and Aurora Elena.  Aurora, 61, has a grocery store; she' had it for over 27 years and started it with just a few items so it has improved daily.  The reason for the loan is to buy basic grains, milk, eggs, soups and bread, among others.  She dreams with improving every day and increasing her inventory.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Vlas

texts.en:
Vlas comes from the village of Kveda Simoneti in the Imereti region. He is 30 years old and lives with his wife, Nana, a 10-year-old boy and his 72-year-old father.

All the family members are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, the milk of which is used for cheese production. Family members sell approximately 7 kg of cheese at the local market each Friday. Also they have a pig and sell piglets in the village. Along with the above mentioned work,  the family grows maize on a half hector of land. Almost all the maize is used in the family farm. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 900 GEL. With the requested credit, Vlas plans to build a bath house for the family, as they don’t have one now. It will significantly improve the quality of life for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for bathhouse construction.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka comes from the village of Nakhshirghele in the Imereti district. He is 34 years old and lives with his wife, Maya, their 7-year-old daughter, Lika, and his mother. 

Mamuka and Maya head the agricultural business of the family. They have two milk cows and sell approximately 50 kg of cheese per month to local dairy products retailers. Also the family owns 0.7 hectare of agricultural land, where they grow tomatoes, strawberries and other crops. The sell the harvested fruit and vegetables locally. 

Along with working at their own farm, Mamuka and Maya also work in neighborhood farms as milkers. Each of them gets a monthly salary in the amount of 100 GEL. 

With the requested credit, Mamuka plans to renovate the cattle shed, as it is already old and needs to be renovated before winter starts. Otherwise it won’t keep a warm temperature in the winter and the cows may be damaged. 

In the future, Mamuka plans to save and renovate his house to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate the cattle shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: La Señora Carla Vanessa de 23 años, reside en el municipio de la Paz pues su  hijo vive con ella. Ella es una mujer llena de metas y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante. Carla tiene su negocio que es el destace de cerdos ubicado en su vivienda,  ya que ella se destaca por ofrecer una buena calidad en sus productos y por ser amable con su clientela. Es por eso que le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar más cerdos. ella tiene gran esperanza en que esto le permitirá mejorar la economía de su hogar y así aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carla Vanessa, 23, lives in the town of La Paz; her son lives with her.  She is a woman who is full of goals and lots of enthusiasm to get ahead.  She has a pig butchering business located in her home.  She stands out because she offers high quality products and for being very kind to her clientele.  Because of this she's asking for a loan to buy more pigs.  Her great hope is that this will make it possible for her to improve her home's economy and thus be able to aspire to better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Liliana Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Liliana Del Socorro tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, ella tiene 50 años es madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo. Ella realiza sus actividades diarias del hogar antes de salir a vender a ofrecer sus diferentes productos, Liliana trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8 la noche por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar polvos, cremas, perfumes y tratamientos. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Liliana Del Socorro's business is selling cosmetics.  She is 50 years old and a single mother of a son who is in her care.  She does her daily domestic chores before going out to sell her various products.  Liliana works from 8am until 8pm for she is always seeking ways to improve her income.  She is asking for the loan to buy talc, creams, perfume and treatments.  She commits to make her installment payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Angel Grabiel

texts.es:
Ángel, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, él es carpintero y el taller lo tiene en su casa de habitación, lo inicio hace 13 años y trabaja todos los días.
Actualmente necesita financiamiento para la compra de madera de cedro, pegamento, pintura y playwood, con esta compra fortalecerá su taller de materiales necesarios para la elaboración de muebles, atendiendo cualquier trabajo que necesiten sus clientes.
Su aspiración es tener el taller surtido de materiales, poder emplear personas para que le ayuden a atender la demanda y por supuesto que aumentar la clientela, con esto dará una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel owns his house where he lives with his wife and two children who are 12 and 6 years of age.  He's a carpenter and his workshop is located at home.  He started it 13 years ago and he works every day.

He currently needs financing to buy cedar wood, adhesives, paint and plywood.  This purchase will strengthen his workshop with the necessary materials to make furniture being able to do whatever job his customers need.

His goal is to have his shop better stocked with materials, to be able to employ people to help him meet demand and, of course, to increase his clientele.  This will lead to better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cedar wood, adhesives, paint and plywood.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma tiene 45 años, habita en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Glicer y sus 2 queridos hijos a quienes ama. Su negocio esta ubicado en el centro artesanal del poblado, ella está convencida que la variedad de sus productos incrementarán sus ventas, es por eso que se esmera mucho en no repetir modelos. Además de tener buenos ingresos con la venta de sus propias creaciones. “Mi esposo me ayuda en la confección de tapices y mantas”, menciona Enma, “mientras yo me dedico al tejido con palitos de madera”; de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos. Lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Pero le reconforta la idea de estar juntando dinero para comprarse una movilidad propia, ya que también recibe un porcentaje de S/.400 a S/. 500 soles por el cobro de luz a los pobladores de la zona. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Además es muy querida en su banco comunal por ser una persona responsable, y ello lo demuestra cumpliendo puntualmente con sus cuotas. Enma de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería como: tapices, chompas y demás productos para su tienda artesanal.
texts.en:
Enma is 45 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  She is noted as being a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Glicer and her two children who she loves very much.

Enma's business is located in the craft center in town.  She is convinced that the variety of products she offers increases her sales.  For this reason, she takes a lot of care not to repeat designs.  In addition, she makes good income from selling her own creations.  "My husband helps me in making my tapestries and blankets" Enma says "while I knit with wooden needles".  In this way, Enma is able to pay for her children's education.  She has been in this business for 20 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her handicrafts to her sales stall as she lives a very long way away.  However, she is comforted by the fact that she is putting together some money in order to be able to buy her own vehicle as she also receives a percentage of .400 to .500 Peruvian soles from charging people in her area for electricity.

In the future, Enma hopes to put together the money she needs to set up a store where she can sell her items more peacefully.  She belongs to the 'Mujeres al Futuro' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because she is a responsible person and she demonstrates this by making her loan repayments on time.

With your support, Enma will invest the money that she has requested in buying merchandise such as: tapestries, sweaters and other products for her handicrafts store.

loans.use: to buy tapestries, sweaters and other hand-made products

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 34 años habita en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Ahí formó su familia junto a su esposo, Ambos tienen 6 menores hijos a los que quieren mucho y cuidan en su casa propia. El trabajo constante le enseñó a ser una persona optimista y luchadora. A pesar de las constantes dificultades que tiene, siempre mantiene el ánimo para salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica es la artesanía, elaborando prendas de vestir a base de lana de diferentes colores y texturas. Su secreto es elaborar las prendas de forma manual, así inyecta su propio esfuerzo y sentimiento a lo que realiza. Además cuenta que la elaboración de mantas es su especialidad, ya que lo comercializa por intermediarios a la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco, donde por ser zona frígida tiene mucha demanda del producto. Al mes Elvia realiza de 4 a 5 frazadas de las cuales obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de papa por temporada, solo una vez al año, extrayendo un producto lleno de vitaminas y con un excelente sabor, debido a que la tierra reposa durante un tiempo antes de ser sembrado. Pero su principal deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus tejidos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además agradece a su banco comunal por confiar en ella, razón por lo que se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas. Elvia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de lana, madejas y varios hilos de colores para continuar con la confección de prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Elvia is 34 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. She started a family there together with her husband. They have six minor children that they love very much and care for in their own home. Constant work taught her to be an optimistic person and a fighter.

Despite the constant difficulties that she has, she always maintains her spirit to get ahead. The work she makes her living at is artisan crafts, making wool garments in different colors and textures. Her secret is to make the garments by hand and that way she brings her own effort and feelings into what she does.

She also mentions that her specialty is making blankets. She sells them through intermediaries in the city of Corre de Pasco where there is a lot of demand for the product because it is a cold area. Elvia makes between 4 and 5 blankets per month from which she makes a good profit.

Additionally she plants potatoes seasonally, just once per year. The result is a product full of vitamins and excellent flavor due to the fact that the land lies fallow for a time before being planted. But her main desire is to improve the quality of her weavings.

She belongs to the “Mujeres al Futuro” community bank and this is her first loan with MFP where she awaits your collaboration to be able to press on with her goals. She also thanks the community bank for having confidence in her, which is why she is committing to being punctual with her repayments. Upon receiving the support, Elvia will invest the money requested into the purchase of wool, skeins of yarn and several colors of thread to continue to make artisanal items.

loans.use: to buy wool and different colored thread.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.
