He is a hardworking man who says, "Now my business is operating successfully so I want to increase my working capital." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to expand his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Tsogbadrah

texts.en:
Tsogbadrah is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two daughter, ages 20 and 22, both attend college. With the help of his wife, a conductor, Tsogbadrah manages a public transportation business between Narantuul market and Tsaiz market.

Tsogbadrah started his business in 1999 and is planning to continue his business into the future. He has repaired his bus for it to be safe for his customers. He is now requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new bus.

With his earnings he built a house for his family. He is a responsible man who says, "I want to save enough money for my two daughters’ education."

loans.use: To purchase a new bus.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a hardworking and active 33-year-old business lady. She is single and has three children aged fifteen, eleven and five going to school. Previously, Naomi was a house wife, but for the past six years she has been operating a beauty salon.

Naomi is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair braids, weaves and oils. In five years she hopes to have a big salon as well as to sell beauty products. She feels that with the extra income from her business she will be able to realize her dream of opening up a beauty college.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, weaves and oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothing for sale.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo al igual que su esposa se han esforzado  para estar arreglando la vivienda que adquirieron como patrimonio de sus hijos y por este motivo, trabajan día  con día para darle una mejor imagen y como han ido ampliando poco  a poco  su  hogar a través de créditos con esta institución, están muy agradecidos por la ayuda que se les ha brindado para avanzarle a los cambios y modificaciones que hasta la  fecha le  han realizado a  su hogar lo cual les  han permitido  brindarles a  sus  hijos  una mayor  comodidad y  así  ellos se  encuentran mas  tranquilos , una de las prioridades que el Sr. Gustavo tiene es instalar el vitropiso a una de las habitaciones que amplio y al hacer estos mejoramiento la casa además de verse limpia y ordenada, evitaran  que la tierra   pueda  dañar  la  salud  de  sus  hijos .
texts.en: Mr. Gustavo and his wife have worked hard to fix up the home that they bought for their children's inheritance. They work day in, day out to improve the home, and have done so bit by bit through loans from this institution. They are very grateful for the help that has been offered to them to speed up the changes that they have made to their home. These improvements have allowed them to offer their children better comfort, as their home is now more peaceful. One of Mr Gustavo's priorities is to install floor tiles in one of the rooms that he is expanding. This will make it more clean and orderly, and prevent damage to his children's health from the dirt floor.

loans.use: to install floor tiles in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, American rice, beans, beef, oil, toilet paper, flour, chicken and eggs

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Alma es  una persona  responsable  y  muy trabajadora  acudió con nosotros para solicitar su crédito ya que desea terminar  la pared de una  habitación de  su  domicilio   de la  cual  había  realizado  la  construcción  con anterioridad, agradece  de antemano  el  apoyo brindado  por la  institución para la realización de  su  proyecto, ya  que   ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  ofrecer  a su  familia una  mayor  comodidad y  una excelente imagen a  su  domicilio.
texts.en:
Alma is a responsible, very hard working woman who came to us to request a loan because she wants to finish off the wall in one of the rooms in her house that she built recently.  

She thanks in advance for the support provided by the institution for her to carry out her project because she sees in the loan the possibility of providing her family with more comfort and an excellent image for her house.

loans.use: to finish off the walls on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, American rice, sugar, beef, oil, cheese, chicken and instant coffee

loans.name: Jose  Antonio

texts.es: El señor  José  es  una persona  muy trabajadora  que  se  dedica  a la  venta  de pan la  cual  realiza  por  las  calles  de la   ciudad en su  automóvil, en  esta  ocasión  requiere  de nuestro  apoyo  ya  que  su trasporte  esta  sufriendo  algunas  fallas  mecánicas  por lo que  necesita  realizar la  reparación, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para la realización de  su proyecto ya  que  este  negocio  representa  la  forma de  obtener  ingresos  la  cual le   permite  sacar  adelante  a su  familia  que representa lo  mas  importante  en su  vida.
texts.en: José is a very hard-working person who sells bread in the city streets in his car.  On this occasion, he needs our support as his car is experiencing some mechanical problems and needs to be repaired.  He is grateful for the support that we have given him to carry out his project as his business is the way in which he makes income to get his family ahead.  His family is the most important thing in his life.

loans.use: to have his car repaired

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe es  una persona  muy  responsable y trabajadora   que actualmente   tiene   una  tienda de   abarrotes  la  cual le  permite  mantener   su  hogar ,  en esta  ocasión  el desea   realizar  la  compra  de mercancía para  poder   ofertarles a   sus  clientes   una mayor  variedad de productos , ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad de continuar   ofreciendo a su clientela  un  excelente  servicio lo  cual  siempre  lo a  caracterizado  además  de   incrementar  sus  ingresos  que le  permitirán  tener  una excelente  calidad  de    vida.
texts.en: Mr. Felipe is a very responsible and hard-working person who currently has a grocery store which allows him to maintain his household. At the moment, he wants to purchase merchandise in order to be able to offer his customers a better variety of products. He sees in this loan the possibility of continuing to offer his customers the excellent service that has always characterized his business, as well as increasing his income so that he will have an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mariama. She is married and has two children aged twelve and nine. She has three additional dependents, her younger sisters, who live with her because they are going to school.

In 1996, Mariama established her palm oil business. Before this she had sold ginger cake, then food stuff items, then finally landed in palm oil sales. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, she serves between five to twenty customers a day. She earns about 700,000 SLL every month.

Mariama would like a loan of 3,500,000 SLL to buy additional palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mariama plans to be an agent for one of the soap-making factories in the east.

She comments, “I was nervous that the high cost of palm oil would bring few profits, and that there was so much competition for the same commodity. But with my training at the A.R.D. workshop before acquiring my loan, I will put in practice what I have learned. I have the confidence that my profit margin will increase, thus taking me to a brighter future.”

Mariama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional palm oil.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and supports his wife, one child aged two years, plus his mother and father who live with him.

In 2010, Ibrahim took over his aged father’s business due to its falling income. He had to tell his dad to rest while he took over and injected more capital into the business. Working seven days a week and seventeen hours a day, he earns about 1,141,000 SLL every month.

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 SLL to enable him to use 320,000 SLL to buy mayonnaise, 300,000 SLL to buy luncheon meat, 120,000 to buy sardines, 216,000 SLL to buy powdered milk and 100,000 SLL to buy one carton of soap. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,141,000 SLL.

In the future Ibrahim plans to own a house, establish a larger business and give his child a quality education. He is very excited about and thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To buy products for his food stall.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has no children but has four additional dependents who live with her while going to school.

In 2006, Salamatu established her palm oil business to help her husband provide a livelihood for their dependents. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month.

As the high cost of palm oil is greatly reducing her profit margins, Salamatu would like a loan of 3,500,000 SLL in order to buy 35 five-gallon containers of palm oil at 100,000 SLL each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.

In the future, Salamatu plans to build a bigger store where she could store larger quantities of palm oil. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 35 five-gallon containers of palm oil at 100,000 SLL each.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
En el estado D. VeraC. D. L. llave existe una pequeña comunidad llamada El Paraiso, L. cual se encuentra ubicada en L. carretera Cordoba-veraC., en esta pequeña comunidad existe una UD.(Grupo integrado por mas D. dies personas que tienen una cuanta en el banco y se reunen semanalmente) llamada Flor D. campo.

L. señora Julisa es uno D. los once miembros D. este grupo,elL. tiene L. edad D. 41 años, estudio solo L. primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor juan el cual trabaja en el campo, doña julissa tuvo tres hijos pero actualmente solo depenD. D. elL. el mas pequeño llamado plablo D. 12 años que asiste a L. primaria D. su comunidad.

doña Julissa nos platica que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora desD. que dejo D. estudiar su madre le enseño a trabajar en las labores del hogar y a preparar antojitos mexicanos como chiles reyenos y tamales lo cual le ha ayudado mucho ya que desD. que se caso ha ralizado sus ventas D. comida los fines D. semana para poder ganar un poco D. dinero extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, EL. venD. sus antojitos con sus amigos y vecinos D. L. comunidad, primero realiza los tamales y chiles cuando ya estan listos los coloca en cubetas y sale a vender casa por casa y gracias a Dios siempre venD. todo, Doña julissa ademas D. vender antojitos tambien venD. carne D. res y cerdo los dias Miercoles, jueves y viernes. elL. necesita este credito para invertirlo en L. compra D. carne, chiles, Huevos, tomates, cebolL., maiz, leña, hojas D. platano , aceite y bolsas plasticas.

elL. nos platica que su venta le ha ayudado mucho ya que poco a poco con L. ayuda D. su esposo ha contruido su casa D. material y espera con sus ganancias seguir L. contruccion ya que quiere que sus hijos tengan un patrimonio y nada les falte.

los otros diez integrantes son:

maria venta D. abarrotes, alejandro zapatos, Galvina papeleria, Alberta venta D. ropa, rosa venta D. zapatos, juana venta D. ropa, juana B venta D. abarrotes, maria cristina venta D. pan, esteban venta D. pan y tomasa venta D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
In the state of VeraC. D. L. Llave there is a small community called El Paraíso that’s located along the Cordoba-VeraC. highway.  There is a small communal bank (a group of more than ten people that has an account in the bank and that meet weekly) called “Flor D. Campo.”  

Julissa is one of the eleven members of this group.  She is 41 years old and only went to elementary school.  She’s married to Juan, who is a field hand.  Julissa has three children but only the youngest, Pablo, 12, is still dependent on her.  He goes to the local elementary school.

Julissa tells us that she’s always been a very hard working woman.  When she left school her mother taught her to work doing domestic chores and to prepare Mexican fast food like “chiles rellenos” (stuffed chili peppers) and tamales which has been very useful for her because since she got married she has been selling food on weekends to earn a little extra money to help her husband with household expenses.  She sells her snacks among friends and neighbors in the community.  First, she makes the tamales and the chiles and when they are ready she places them in buckets and goes out door to door selling them.  Thanks to God, she always sells out everything.  Besides selling fast food snacks, Julissa also sells beef and pork on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays.  She needs this loan to buy meat, chilies, eggs, tomatoes, onion, corn, firewood, banana leaves, oil and plastic bags.  She tells us that sales have helped her a lot because bit by bit she’s helped her husband build a house out of substantial materials and she hopes to use her profits to continue with the construction because she wants to have something to leave her children and that they not want for anything.

The other ten members are:

María – grocery sales

Alejandro- shoe sales

Galvina – stationery sales

Alberta-clothing sales

Rosa-shoe sales

Juana-clothing sales

Juana B.- grocery sales

María Cristina-bread sales

Esteban-bread sales

Tomasa-grocery sales

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home furniture for her matrimonial home

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip, married and a mother of two daughters and two sons. Huda's husband (who is photographed here, as she is a conservative woman) owns an advertising agency. Huda took out a $1,000 loan as her husband is in need of a printer and fax machine. Huda's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He opened the advertising agency to have a better income to support his family. Huda helps her husband manage the agency when he is away from the office.

loans.use: to buy a printer and fax machine

loans.name: Kifaia

texts.en: Kifaia is a 45-year-old young woman who is married with five children three boys and two girls. She wants a loan of $1189.04 to buy new and additional home furniture, as number of her family members is getting bigger and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who has a decent salary that doesn't help him buying furniture in cash. So, when Kifaia gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis amount, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and live in better conditions with the family. Kifaia is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's branch office.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Walaa'

texts.en:
Walaa' is a 20-year-old young woman who is married with one child. She lives with her family in Jabalia Refugee Camp, which is located in Gaza Strip. Walaa' took out a $2,500 loan from FATEN to buy living room furniture. Walaa's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary that doesn't help him to buy furniture in cash. On the other hand, with the help of FATEN's loan she can purchase the needed furniture items.
Walaa' is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase living room furniture

loans.name: Ankhbat

texts.en:
Ankhbat is a 23-year-old hardworking man. He lives with his parents and younger sister in a small house in the outer districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ankhbat graduated from college where he specialized in carpentry. He now works as a carpenter at Tsaiz, a local construction and building materials market, and regularly gets paid.

Since 2005, when Ankhbat started working at Tsaiz market, he has been improving his family’s living standards with the profits he has made. His parents and elder sister have also financially contributed with their salaries. He bought a small plot of land in 2005, built a summer house on it in 2007 and purchased a new ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in 2008. Recently, he bought a washing machine, television and personal computer for himself.

During the wintertime, the temperature goes below -40 C in Ulaanbaatar. Ankhbat is now planning to renovate his parents’ summer house by inserting a heating system so that his family can enjoy living in the house during the harsh winter. He is covering the house with bricks and stone blocks as well. To finish up his building project, he needs a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy essential construction materials.

Ankhbat is responsible, ambitious and a very neat person. He is striving to provide a fine quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy building materials to renovate his parents' summer house.

loans.name: Salha

texts.en: Salha is a 44-year-old woman, married and a mother of two daughters and three sons. Salha and her family live in the Biet Lahia area in Gaza Strip. Salha's husband owns a shop providing services of cleaning up and polishing tiles. Salha received a loan of $1,500 in order to buy two tile polishing machines to replace the old one used currently. Salha's husband wants to expand his work due to the increasing demand for providing this service in the area where he lives. Salha's husband also used the loan from FATEN to purchase polishing machine soap as well as its accessories. The new machines will secure a better income for the family and attract more customers. Salha is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in the shop.

loans.use: to buy two tile polishing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to furnish her newly-built small house.

loans.name: Bat-Tsetseg

texts.en:
Bat-Tsetseg, a 31-year-old single mother, lives with her younger sisters and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her sisters attend university, while her mother works as an engineer on contract at several companies.

In 2005, with 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) of working capital, Bat-Tsetseg started operating a sweets and cigarettes wholesale stall at Narantuul, Mongolia's largest outdoor market. Her business has since expanded, and she is now running two stalls and has 6,500,000 MNT of working capital.

Bat-Tsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more products for this summer. In the future she wants to build a new house with her business earnings so that her family can enjoy safe and comfortable living conditions. Bat-Tsetseg is a responsible and hardworking woman who is striving to get ahead and provide a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to import more wholesale products for this summer.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en: Nahla is a 37-year-old young woman, married with two daughters and two sons. She lives with her family in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Nahla's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and that's why she had to take out a $2,000 loan in order to buy furniture for her daughters who are growing up and can't share the room with their two brothers anymore. FATEN's loan helped Nahla purchase the furniture and gave her the flexibility of baying back smaller amounts of money on a monthly basis. Nahla is photographed in FATEN's Branch office.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughters' room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Ariuntungalag

texts.en:
Ariuntungalag is 31 years old and lives with her husband, son, 2, and daughter, 10, in a ger (Mongolian Yurt) in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends primary school, while her husband manufactures and sells water carriages at Kharhorin, one of the largest outdoor markets in Mongolia.  Her mother-in-law looks after her son during working hours.

Ariuntungalag supports her family by operating a stall selling building materials at a local market. She sells electric cords, locks, electric plugs, extension cords, wheels and other tools at her stall. Since she started her business in 2005, her working capital had increased from 500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to 2,400,000 MNT.  She is a trusted client of Transcapital Co.,Ltd, and has repaid her previous loan successfully. 

Ariutungalag is applying for a new loan of 500,000 MNT, with the intention of increasing sales by selling more tools and equipment. She is building a new small house and planning to finish before this winter, so that her family can enjoy better living conditions during the harsh winter in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and equipment

loans.name: Hir

texts.en:
Hir is a 55-year-old widow from the village of Naora in northern Israel. Hir and her husband had a successful animal raising business and she sold cheeses and dairy products. Her products had an excellent reputation and were purchased by clients from her village and the region. Unfortunately, after her husband passed away Hir sold the business with the animals. Last year she decided to begin selling her dairy products again but she had to purchase the milk from others. With the help of her family, Hir has reentered the business of raising sheep and making specialty cheeses, labane and yogurt.

Hir needed this loan to purchase sheep and lambs, prepare her barn and purchase equipment.

In the future, Hir wishes to further expand and purchase modern milking and cheese making equipment.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and lambs, prepare her barn and purchase equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional chickens and supplies for the chicken coop in her yard

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is a divorced mother of two who immigrated to Israel from the FSVU.  Rema came to Israel educated and prepared to succeed but job possibilities were slim. She decided to use her business acumen and start a small microenterprise. She began small and has created a stable microbusiness. She's been running a small clothing store in the city of Ashkelon since the end of 2009. Rema is now prepared to further strengthen her business and create much needed additional income.

She took this loan to expand her inventory, increase the amount of clothes she has to sell and prepare for the upcoming summer months.

Rema enjoys her business and is proud how it is developing. She wants to see it expand further and dreams of one day opening a small chain of stores that sell clothes from Turkish and Israeli suppliers.

loans.use: to expand her inventory to prepare for sales in the summer months.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en: Khetam is a 28-year-old woman. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Khetam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase living room furniture that they couldn't purchase when she got married. She was using plastic chairs instead. Now that she learned about FATEN, she took out the loan to pay for the furniture and pay the loan back on a daily basis. Khetam is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's Branch office.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a young man from Deir Al Balah in Gaza Strip. Hasan has a small store selling computer accessories such as mice, keyboards, covers, cleaning liquids, etc.

Hasan has been working in his store for two years now. He came to FATEN asking for a loan to purchase a large amount of items to sell, which will increase the income he makes and attract more customers. 

Hasan is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories such as mice, keyboards, covers, etc

loans.name: Adeeb

texts.en:
Adeeb is a 26-year-old young man who lives with his family in Tulkarem City in Palestine. He wants a loan of $3,000 to pay back his brothers as he borrowed the money to finish building his house. Adeeb is a Palestinian National Authority employee and works at a car maintenance workshop to have a good income.

Adeeb is photographed in FATEN's office in Tulkarem.

loans.use: to pay back money to his brothers that he borrowed to finish building his house

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta is 53 years old and married. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.  She has been growing rice and corn crops for over 20 years. According to Inocenta, her recent monthly earnings from farming are 4500 PHP.

Inocenta has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm provisions.  In the future, Inocenta hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm provisions

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 2.

Jelyn and her husband are both farmers. She helps till their land and grow crops, such as rice and corn.  Jelyn works hard to support her family.  She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.  Jelyn hopes this loan will help improve their farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim, 50, is a widow woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City.  To earn a living, she opens a small business inside her house for selling coffee and other soft drinks to her neighbors or other travelers. From this business, Mrs. Kim could make around $10 each day to ensure that her family lives a comfortable life. 

She is a hard-working woman who tries to make money to feed her four single children, most of whom are enrolled to school. Furthermore, they always assist her in selling coffee when they have time away from school. In order to increase her profit as well as making her business successful, Mrs. Kim would like to ask for some funds from Kiva lenders to add more investment so as she can use it to buy additional coffees and soft drinks for selling.

loans.use: to buy additional coffees and soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Has

texts.en:
Mr. Has is 34-year-old married man and father. He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Kompong Chhnang Province. He owns a piece of land tH. he inherited from his grandmother. He grows different kinds of crop on his land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and rice crop, which he will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. His wife has grown these crops with him. The couple is married and has three school-age children. 

Because of lacking fertilizers, Mr. Has’ crops are not growing well and he doesn’t have sufficient cash to buy more fertilizers.  Mr. Has would like to request a loan to purchase a few sack of fertilizers to help his crops grow. He hopes to use the remaining loan funds to buy more gasoline to pour in his plowing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a few sack of fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Juvelin

texts.en:
Juvelin is 30 years old and married. She has 2 young children, aged 8 and 7.  Her husband works as a farmer and palm oil harvester.

Juvelin is also a farmer. She has been growing rice with her husband for 8 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities.  Juvelin hopes to save for her children's education. She also hopes for their business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach is a 47-year-old married woman who has been planting rice crops. She lives in the province of Siem Reap, where she also sells a few fish in the local market with her husband for extra profit. 

Meach is married with four young children and currently resides with her husband, who assists her in selling fish and growing crops. To add more income to support her family’s demands, Meach has also raised some piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Meach has requested a loan of $400 that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Ceriwis Group

texts.en:
For the past six years Legi, a 49-year-old married mother of four children, has been selling Yakult (a probiotic milk-like product made of skimmed milk which is very popular in Indonesia) in her mobile store. With many loyal customers, she uses the income to support her family and pay her children's school fees.

Legi will use her portion of the loan to buy more Yakult to sell in her community. She plans to grow her business and develop other enterprises as her income grows. She also wants to buy a motorcycle to facilitate her sales as well as save money to pay for her daughter's college tuition this year.

loans.use: to buy more Yakult from the agent to sell to her community.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang has been in the farming business for many years. She learned this skill from her parents, since she was single till the present time. She can plant her crops at least twice per year, the rainy season and dry season. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a natural medicine maker. Her husband always combines different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and sells them in a mobile place. 

They are blessed with two children who study in public school in the Ornlong Vegn district of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Leang will use the loan that she requests toward purchasing more natural roots for her husband to make natural medicines for selling, so her husband’s business runs smoothly and brings more net income.

loans.use: to purchase more natural roots for her husband to make natural medicines for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy snacks like chiki to fill in her new little shop

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
A villager who resides in Kompong Speu Province, Mrs. Pok is 57 and the mother of five children; four are single and one is already married. She has two children who can generate some of their income by working in a garment factory as domestic garment workers. 

Mrs. Pok is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for a long time. Her husband also works in the same business. Recently, she has needed more money to repair her broken house, so Mrs. Pok has requested a loan of $600. She will use the rest of loan funds to support her crop-planting business. Mrs. Pok was pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen resides in Reussey Keo commune, located in Phnom Penh. In previous times, she used to operate a small business selling fish in the busy market, but now she is a homemaker who manages the household and other cash flow in the total family. 

Mrs. Sen is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children, three married and two single. She currently relies on her children who work; one is a cloth seller and the other one is a garment factory worker who has a specific salary. Mrs. Sen is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motor which will be used by one of her kids to ride to work and also to mend her old house which is in need of repair.

loans.use: a motor which will use by her kid to ride to work and also to mend her old house.

loans.name: Rosemalina

texts.en:
Rosemalina is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosemalina has a variety store business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase items like diapers, snack foods, etc. to sell in her store. 

Rosemalina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like diapers and snack foods to sell in her store

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tan has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband earns a living as a furniture maker. He often produces furniture such as tables and chairs. 

This couple has been married for years and has four children, all of whom are  attending school in the Ang Snoul district. Mrs. Tan sees that her husband's job is profitable so she has decided to apply for a loan to purchase a secondhand motorbike for her husband to drive to his job location as well as for the transportation needs of the family. 

Mrs. Tan and her husband appear in the photo next to their house.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorbike

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom are adults. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of owning a fresh water selling business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase timber and cement and to pay for a license.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase timber and cement and to pay for a license.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, he has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby.  He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business.  Michael dreams of expanding his business and establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, he wants to purchase a sewing machine. He decided to join Yehu because of efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. Elina dreams of expanding her business and purchasing livestock to start a livestock business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, maize flour and wheat flour for sale. She decided to go to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables, maize flour and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is a 39 year-old married father of four children between ten and sixteen years old.  Luke owns a garage in Mazeras.  His business has been in operation for the last five years and has been a success.
 
Luke has been a KADET client, and this marks his fourth loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase a variety of spare parts for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.  His hope and dream is to own a showroom and to become a successful car salesman.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more liters of milk for sale

loans.name: Anasi

texts.en:
Anasi is a 24 year-old married mother of two children. She sells clothes in Mikindani, Mombasa.  Her business has been in operation for one year.
 
She has been a KADET client, and this marks her third loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase bales of clothes.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan.  Her  dream is to open a clothes stall.

loans.use: purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene owns and operates a small sari-sari store at home and sells assorted food items. She is 39 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has three grown children. Arlene has been in this business for over three years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month from this business. 

Arlene has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery stock and soft drinks to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business and earn more income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock and soft drinks to sell.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 24 year-old single mother of one child.  She runs a beauty salon in Mshomoroni, Mombasa.  Her business has been in operation for the last two years.
 
She  has been a KADET client and this marks her second  loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of cosmetics and hair products. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her  dream is to relocate her beauty salon into bigger business premises.

loans.use: to add  more stock of cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
29-year-old Loida is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 6.  She is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa,  Agusan Del Sur.  She has been growing rice and corn crops for 5 years. Loida earns about 3200 PHP per month doing this farming.

Loida has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, like urea. She hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, like urea

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 22 years old, single, and lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. John is a motorcycle taxi driver who provides passenger service in the local community. He has been engaged in this service for over two years. He earns PHP 10,000 each month from this service. He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. John has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, John hopes to have a computer cafe and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie is from the village of Cabungaan, three kilometers away from the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 43 years old, married, and a mother of nine school-age children.

Wennie is a farmer. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years. Quarterly, she earns PHP 21,000 from farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay the labor costs for harvesting and milling.

Wennie has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Wennie hopes to purchase a hectare of land for corn plantation and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harvesting and milling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity and add more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 34-year-old married father of three children aged between five years and two months old.  He runs a poultry business in Mariakani, a business that has been in operation for the last two years and has been a success.
 
Hamisi has been a KADET client and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more chicks for sale in his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.  His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: purchase more chicks

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 51-year-old single lady.  She runs a curio shop in Nyali, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last seven years.
 
Purity has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase khanga's,  sculptures and jewelry for her business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan.  Her  dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: purchase khanga’s, sculptures and jewelry

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Разведена. У неё один ребенок. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 9 лет Нигина занимается продажей тканей. Кредит хочет взять для закупа тканей оптом.
texts.en: Nigina lives in the region of Tursun-zoda. She has one child. She has secondary education and has been in the business of selling fabrics for more than nine years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in wholesale

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is from the village of Gala, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is 37 years old, married and a father of four school-age children.
Rogelio is a farmer. He plants and harvests bananas to earn a living. He sells bananas at retail and by volume in the local community, which is the only means of income for his family. He has been engaged in this business for over 15 years. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000 from farming. He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase banana tissue culture seedlings. Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for over seven years. In the future, Rogelio hopes to expand his banana business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase banana tissue culture seedlings.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 37 years old and lives in Lam-an, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-age children. Mary Grace has a food vending business to earn a living. She has a small food stall at the market where she sells viands, snacks, and refreshments. She has been running her business for over two years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase kitchen utensils and raw ingredients.

Mary Grace has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to have a food court in the city and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and raw ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for becoming a partner in Cars Laundry.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is separated and a father of one school-age child. He is 36 years old and lives in Colambotan Bajo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Domingo owns and operates a business venture in construction. He purchases timber trees and manages his work using a chainsaw .He has been engaged in this business for over four years. He earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month from this activity. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to purchase coconut trees to sell as timber. Domingo has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Domingo hopes to expand his business and have a construction supply store in the city.

loans.use: To purchase coconut trees to sell as timber

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 48 years old and lives in the village of Cabungaan, four kilometers away from the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age children.

Catalina has a small market at home. She also has a second business planting and harvesting corn. Her main business is selling assorted food products in the community. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase rice and corn grains to sell. 

Catalina has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Catalina hopes to expand her retail business and purchase additional land for corn production.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn grains to sell.

loans.name: Junido

texts.en:
Junido is 32 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is separated and a father of one school-age child.

Junido is a motorycle taxi driver. He owns and operates a service-based business providing passenger services in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for three years. He earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month from this business. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 at GDMPC to pay for the labor cost of a motorcycle repair and to purchase tires and spare parts.

Junido has been member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Junido hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle and to have his own house and lot.

loans.use: To pay the labor cost for a motorcycle repair and to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old and single. She lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Janet has a retail business to earn a living. The main source of income  for the business comes from the selling of different food products and refreshments. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She earns a total average of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stock and soft drinks to sell.

Janet has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Janet hopes to expand her business and hopes that she can build a house from her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three adult children.

Rosalinda is a farmer. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 30 years. She earns a total average of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Rosalinda has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her corn land and purchase a motorcycle for the delivery of her products.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Cena

texts.en:
Cena is 59 years of age.  She is married and is blessed with 4 children. She runs a food stall in her village and has been in this business for almost 5 years. She sells different kinds of dishes and cooked snacks. Her net income monthly is 5,000 PHP.  

Cena is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients to cook more food to sell. She hopes to continue to have access to loans and achieve her dreams for her children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: purchase raw ingredients to cook food for sale

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 52 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops on their land. According to Nicanora, they can earn as much as 9000 PHP per month, but this income is not stable due to weather conditions.

Nicanora has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes for their harvest to increase.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Erismus

texts.en:
Erismus is a 54-year-old married man with ten children.  They are living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  His family dream is to educate his children up to university level.  

Erismus has been a milk sales man for two years.  His major challenge is late payment by his customers since they pay on a monthly basis.  Erismus needs this loan to buy a milk container that can keep the milk cool for selling.

loans.use: buy a modern milk container to keep milk

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong is 45 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than six years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and from other fishermen. Her husband is a construction worker in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. The family makes  approximately $12 each day to use for their needs. 

Mrs. Suong will use a loan from Kiva to purchase more fish to sell at the market. She will also use some of the money to buy zinc to repair the cracked roof of her house. Mrs. Suong has two children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale and to repair her home's roof

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, 38 years of age, is married and blessed with 5 children. She's engaged in the livestock business, particularly in hog-raising. She's been in this business for almost 5 years. Her net income every three months is 5,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her hogs. She would like to continue to have access to loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her hogs

loans.name: Arzar's Group

texts.en:
Arzar is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a taxi driver.  With her husband, she is raising two daughters and two sons. The youngest daughter studies at university and the other children are employed. Arzar works as a teacher at school.  In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, she breeds livestock and then sells it at a higher price. In this way she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. 

With money received from the loan, Arzar wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to purchase a piece of land for building a house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 57 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three adult-age children. Jovita has a small market at home selling assorted food products like food in pouches, canned goods, noodles, sweets and coffee. She has been running her business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell.

Jovita has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jovita hopes to expand her retail business and to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to use to fish.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 37 years of age, is married and blessed with 2 children. She's engaged in the livestock business, particularly hog-raising. She's been in this business for almost 5 years. Her net income every three months is 8,000 PHP. 

She's asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her hogs. Her loans in the past have been extremely helpful in providing for the needs of her family, and she hopes that loans will continue to be given to her by Kiva lenders to improve her business more.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her hogs

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en:
Sarouen, 58 year old, is working for the government as a village consultant. Her husband is a farmer; their income is $2 per day. They have five children, two of whom are studying while the other three are working, making $9 per day in income. Every month Sarouen has to spend $77 on food, $20 on school fees and $20 on other expenses.

Because her job does not make her much in income to support her family, Sarouen plans to have a more advantageous career. She thinks that selling groceries is a good idea. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy groceries to sell in front of her house. She expects to earn more money so that she can help her children study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in front of her house.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 40 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age children. Arlyn is a fisherman. She catches fish to earn a living. She supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns an average total of PHP 3,000 each month from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase meters of fishing nets. Arlyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Arlyn hopes to have a brand new fishing boat and purchase land for a fishpond.

loans.use: To purchase meters of fishing net.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammed is a young man from Ramallah in Palestine. Mohammad is engaged and getting married by the end of this summer. He took out a $2,000 loan to pay for finishing his bathroom and installing tiles.

Mohammad is a messenger employed by the Palestinian National Authority in Ramallah with a decent salary. However, he can't pay for the tile installation in cash.

Mohammad is photographed in FATEN's office in Ramallah.

loans.use: to finish his house and install bathrooms

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 47 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Arlyn has a retail shop at home selling different food products like canned goods, food in pouches, noodles, candies and milk in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 3,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase grocery stocks to sell.

Arlyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her business and purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар проживает в районе Шахринав. Она замужем. У неё трое детей. Санавбар имеет среднее образование. Более 12 лет она занимается продажей женских национальных платьев. Кредит берет для покупки тканей и увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Sanavbar lives in the region of Shahrinav. She is married and has three children. Sanavbar has secondary education. She has been selling traditional national women's dresses for more than twelve years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics and to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 32 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age children. 

Cristy has a retail business selling plastic ware in her hometown. She also sells additional items like cosmetics and beauty products. She supports her family with this type of activity, which she has been doing for three years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 4,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase more stock of plastic ware to sell.

Cristy has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Cristy hopes to expand her business and aspires to improve her family standards.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of plastic ware to sell.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mrs. Hin, 47, is a married woman and the mother of four children. Two of her children are married and living independently; the other two are single. Two of her children are employed. Her husband is Mr. Sam, 55, a local rice farmer.

Mrs. Hin makes a living by selling fresh fish in a very busy Baray market. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to support her family. Mrs. Hin's husband hasn't started to plant his crops yet as he doesn't have the money to do so. Mrs. Hin is applying for this loan to buy seed and fertilizers for their farm and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and a mother of four school-age dependents. She is 42 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evangeline is involved in the manufacturing business. She makes and sells furniture to earn a living. Evangeline supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for five years. She earns a total of PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials for furniture making. 

Evangeline has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her business and change her way of living.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a young woman from Hebron in Palestine, married and a mother of two daughters and three sons. Basma took out a loan of $1,500 to purchase kitchen tools and a kitchen table and chairs. Her husband is an employee with a decent salary. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, helped. Basma is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen tools and a kitchen table and chairs

loans.name: Junrill

texts.en:
Junrill is married and a father of one school-age child. He is 25 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Junrill is a motorcycle taxi driver. He owns and operates a business providing passenger services in the local community. He has been in this type of service for five years. He earns PHP 4,000 each month from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to pay for motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.

Junrill has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Junrill hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle for service.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.

loans.name: Onarhon's Group

texts.en:
Onarhon is 46 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she has raised a son and two daughters. Her son works in construction, the first daughter is a seamstress and the second helps Onarhon with the housework. Onarhon is the leader of this group.

In order to meet the family’s needs, Onarhon works on their farm with her husband. They have been doing so since the collapse of the Soviet Union. With money received from the loan the family wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for farming.

In the future Onarhon wants to see her children wed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 63 years old and a married woman with three adult children. She is a farmer from the town of Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.

Teresa primarily grows rice to sell. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP because she needs to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities. Teresa hopes this loan will help to improve her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is married and a father of two school-age children. He is 31 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Norman is a farmer. He raises chickens for meat production to earn a living. He sells chicken in bulk to the local traders. He supports his family with this type of activity that he has been doing for three years. Each month, he earns a total of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase feeds for the chickens.
 
Norman has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Norman hopes to expand his poultry business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for chickens.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-age dependents.

Evangeline has a small market at home to earn a living. She sells basic food items like rice and corn grains, biscuits, and canned goods. Evangeline supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for three years. She earns PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her retail store and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of one school-age child.

Janeth has a retail store at home where she sells canned goods, biscuits, coffee, milk, sweets and baked goods. She has been doing this for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Janeth has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Janeth hopes to renovate her store building and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Merie Cris

texts.en:
Merie Cris is a married woman and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 38 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Merie Cris has a small market at home to earn a living. She sells assorted food products like food in pouches, coffee, milk in sachets, sugar and canned goods. She supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for five years. She earns a monthly total of PHP 3,000 doing this activity. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Merie Cris has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Merie Cris hopes to add a new retail shop in the market and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hammad

texts.en:
Hammad is a 53-year-old man. He is a driver and owns a public transportation bus. Hammad wants a loan of $1,500 to pay fees for car insurance and licensing. Due to Hammad's decent income, he couldn't pay the fees all together. Therefore, he took out a loan from FATEN, which helped him pay the fees and was easier on him to repay on a monthly basis.

The bus is the only source of income for Hammad's family. Hammad is photographed next to his bus.

loans.use: to pay fees for car insurance and licensing.

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is 38 years old and married with three children.  She does tailoring, has employed three people, and has been in the business for seven years.  She runs her business in a competitive environment and is able to retain her customers because of her good customer-care skills and good services.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training in customer-care skills.

Ziporah hopes to grow her business within five years.  She needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Sien

texts.en:
Sien (pictured above) is 54 years old, and her husband Ath is 55 years old.  They live in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from the city.  They have eight sons and two daughters.  Three are married and live outside the family home; the others are in school.

Sien and her husband are farmers.  They grow rice and vegetables.  Sien is asking for a loan of $800 to assist her son, who is married, by buying a motorbike to transport vegetables to market.

loans.use: To assist her son by buying a motorbike to transport vegetables to market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes, carrots, and cabbages.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is a garment worker, while her husband Chhen is a fisherman and drives a horse cart.  They live across the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They have been married since 2003 and have two young daughters.

Hoeun is asking for a loan of $400 to help with her husband’s fishing business by buying a new boat and motor.

Both Hoeun and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s fishing business by buying a new boat and motor.

loans.name: Sokean

texts.en:
Sokean is 29 years old, and her husband Sophal is 32.  They have been married since 2003, have two young sons, and are pictured together above.  They live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokean is a weaver, and she also buys finished fabrics from other weavers in her village for resale.  Her husband is a motorcycle repairman.  Sokean is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.  She will also use a part of the loan to buy more finished fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and finished fabrics.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 38 years old, is married, and has three children in school.  He sells mobile-phone accessories to earn a living and has employed one person.  He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he used his first loan to boost his business.

In five years, he hopes to open other outlets of his business.  With a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he will buy mobile-phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en: Ratha (in the photo) is a garment worker and her husband, Savuth, is a farmer. They have been married since 2008 and have one young son. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Ratha is asking for a loan of $1,000 to assists her husband’s farming business by buying a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. She is married and a mother of one son. Riham took out a loan of $1,000 to purchase new home furniture instead of the old ones she has. Her husband is an employee with a decent salary. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, helped her buy better furniture. Getting this loan will make Riham and her family live in better home conditions.

Riham is a religious woman as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong (pictured with her daughter) is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Heng, is a construction worker and farmer. He also raises chickens at home. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: one son and three daughters. Two are in school, one is a garment worker and another one stays with his aunt. 

Kong is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and a single mother of three.  She sells fresh juice to earn a living. She has been operating the business for five years.  With income from her business, she is able to provide for her children, including educating them.
  
Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and open a bakery in five years. She has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy avocado, pineapple, mangoes and pawpaws for making juice.

loans.use: To buy avocado, pineapple, mangoes and pawpaws to make juice

loans.name: Samonn

texts.en:
Samonn is 56 years old and his wife, Sat, is 57 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1978 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. 

Samonn sells porridge. He cooks it himself and carries it on a cart that he attaches to his motorbike (pictured with Samonn). He sells it in his village and the nearby villages. His wife sells sugar cane juice. Samonn is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new trailer because the old one breaks. He will use part of the loan to buy additional materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is hard working and a born-again Christian. He is 32 years old, married and blessed with three children aged 10, 7 and 3. He has been running a cafeteria since 2007. He supplements his income from the salary he gets from his employment as a night guard. He wants, in the next five years, to be a successful businessman. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sack of beans, baking flour, cooking fat and baking powder.

loans.use: To buy a sack of beans, baking flour, cooking fat and baking powder

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 26 years old and her husband, Seng is 29 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have one young daughter. 

Yan sells chickens. She buys chickens from the local market and carries them by her motorbike to sell in Phnom Penh market. Unfortunately, the motorbike was stolen. Because of this, Yan decided to apply for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike. 

Yan and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motor to carry chicken to market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to polish, paint and plaster her husband's taxi

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon (in the photo) is 53 years old and his wife, Chan is 62 years old, have been married since 1979 and have three sons. One is married and lives in separated home, and one is a garment worker and another one assists his parent in the business. They live in a village aL. National Road number 2 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhon and his wife are rice farmers. He is asking a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she brings up two sons and a daughter; the first son studies at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven). In order to meet the family needs, Venera sells clothes on the market. She started eight years ago with an initial investment of 40,000 soms. Her monthly profit is now 18,000 soms. She has applied for a loan because she needs additional funds to purchase summer clothes to sell. In the future, with the profits gained from her trade, Venera plans to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes for sale

loans.name: Young

texts.en:
Mrs. Young, 42, owns a small kiosk in the community for selling food at breakfast and lunch time to her husband's motorbike passengers and to local villagers. She has over five years experience in this business and makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable standard of living. 

She has been married for many years to Mr. Houl, 41, a motor taxi driver, and they are blessed with a baby. Because the old motorbike which her husband uses for his taxi service often breaks down, they are used to spending a lot of money on repairing it. 

Therefore, Mrs. Young is applying for Kiva loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband. She will use the rest of the funds to buy more cooking ingredients for making food to sell. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband and to buy more cooking ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old, married and blessed with five children. She has been selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. She engages in farming to supplement her family's income. In the next five years, she wants to be importing used clothes and selling in wholesale. Her dream is to buy a truck for distributing her merchandise.
She wants a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy trousers in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy trousers for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 6.

Jane is a farmer who tills land in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice crops to sell. Jane usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month from farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Jane hopes to be financially stable and be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 33 years old. He is a husband and father of two daughters and two sons. Ahmed is a farmer growing seasonal vegetables in his land in Jenin city in northern Palestine. Ahmed wants to purchase new seedlings and enrich the variety of vegetables he grows. Ahmed took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the seedlings and fertilizers to make sure he produces a healthy crop and increases his income.

Ahmed is a religious man. Therefore, his wife is photographed instead as he is not comfortable with having his picture on the web.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Natavan

texts.ru: Natavan 32 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Natavan jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i rebonkom. Ona uje 5 let kak imeyet magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya razmesheniya ne tolko pishevix produktov a i moyushix sredstv. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyeyb starshey sestri.
texts.en: Natavan is 32 years old. She is married and has one child. Natavan lives in the Absheron region together with her husband and child. She has owned a grocery store for five years. Right now she needs a loan for 2000 AZN to expand her store to make more room for other inventory, such as household cleaning products. She has learned about this business from her older sister.

loans.use: to expand the store

loans.name: Festo

texts.en: Festo is a hard working 43-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children aged 15, 13, 7 and 5. He has been selling snacks like crisps and mandazis (doughnuts) for the last two years. Festo testifies that through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been trained in business management. His dream is to open up a bakery in the next five years. He wants a loan of 20 000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and baking flour.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and baking flour

loans.name: Ramish

texts.ru:
Ramish rodilsya v 1978 qodu. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. 
Uje 8 let kak Ramish zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Ramish was born in 1978. He is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from the town Fuzili and now lives in the Fuzili region together with his friendly family. He is married and has two children. It has been eight years now since Ramish has been doing animal husbandry and breeding cows. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase their headcount and the volume of milk production for growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is only 6 years old. 

Nerissa has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase hog feeds and vitamins. Each month, Nerissa earns 3,000 PHP through the hog raising business.

In the future, Nerissa hopes for her business to be stable and that it would enable her to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools for manufacturing gypsum and decorations.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира проживает в Кулябском районе. Она замужем. У неё один ребёнок. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет Замира занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев. Она берет кредит для покупки разных видом тканей, чтобы сшить и продать их.
texts.en: Zamira lives in the region of Kulob. She is married and has one child. She has secondary education. Zamira has been sewing traditional national women's dresses for more than five years. She is taking out the loan to buy different kinds of fabrics to make and sell dresses.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabrics

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  KENA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, de l’arachide et du pois sucré avec RAMATOU 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
