Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi 1's ten members are married women who are on average 38 years old with four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kena, one of the villages of Nantien Township in Sikasso prefecture (Mali's third administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to complete their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the organization; previous loans were repaid successfully.
The cultivated crops are rice, groundnuts and tiger nuts for Ramatou, who is standing first from the left in the picture. With her loan, she plans to pay for plowing costs and buy agricultural fertilizers and seeds to maintain 2.5 acres. After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientele comprising men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145,000 CFA per agricultural cycle.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses. She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to better operate her agricultural space and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to pay from plowing costs and agricultural inputs (fertilizers, seeds...)

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.ru: Sarkhan yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Lachin ,seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Sarkhan 33 qoda. Uje 2 qoda kak on otkril kafe. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svoyego kafe. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy i pomog yemu otkrit eto kafe.
texts.en: Sarkhan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Lachin who now lives in the Absheron region.  He is single and has no children.  Sarkhan is 33 years old.  He opened a cafe two years ago.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy chairs and tables for his cafe.  He started this business with his uncle who helped him open the cafe.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Alik's Group

texts.en:
Alik is a member of this group. He is 43 and married to a supervisor in the factory of Kadamjai. Together they bring up two sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at university and the sons are in school. Alik works as a teacher at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs he rents a shop and sells foodstuffs. He is also engaged in cattle breeding. With this loan, Alik wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future he wants to see his children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi to be painted and polished.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
From the province of Siem Reap, Mrs. Pich has been working in the agriculture sector since 2000. She makes a low income from this business, $4 each day, to cover the daily expenses of the family. Her husband also contributes to the family's income; he fishes along the Tunle Sap River. 

Mrs. Pich usually sells fish that her husband catches, as well as those she purchases from other fishermen, for additional income. Presently, the couple has to hire a motor taxi when they need to pick up their fish to sell because they don't have their own vehicle. 

This is the reason why Mrs. Pich is seeking a loan in the amount of $700 to buy a new motorbike for picking up her fish. She will also use part of the loan to purchase more fish for resale. Mrs. Pich has three children; one is married and two are single.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike and also to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with five children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and her youngest is 8.
Rosalinda is in the business of raising hogs. She plans to use her loan to purchase hog feed and vitamins. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP from her hog-raising business. In the future, she hopes for her business to become stable. She also desires to send all her children to college someday.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 3enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  KENA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, de l’arachide et du pois sucré avec MARIAM 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5 hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, on average 35 years old with 3 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Kena, one of the towns in the district of Nantien in the Sikasso Prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to properly manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Mariam, standing all the way on the left in the photo, grows rice, peanuts, and tiger peas. 
With this loan, she intends to pay for labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain 0.5 hectares of land.
The produce is sold throughout the town and at the Sikasso market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize an average profit of 35,000 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To pay for labour and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 34 years old, married and has three children aged between one and five years old. He operates a general store where he sells sugar, flour, tea leaves, cooking oil, beverages and detergents. The business has been in existence for five years and he says it is profitable. Fredrick plans to use this loan to purchase more general items, which he intends to resell.
In the future, Fredrick hopes to grow his business to wholesale. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BENKADI  3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  KENA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, de l’arachide et du pois sucré avec MARIAM, la 1ère accroupie à gauche de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, on average 40 years old with 4 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Kena, one of the towns in the district of Nantien in the Sikasso Prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to properly manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Mariam, crouching all the way on the left in the photo, grows rice, peanuts, and tiger peas. 
With this loan, she intends to pay for labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain 1 hectare of land.
The produce is sold throughout the town and at the Sikasso market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize an average profit of 45,500 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To pay for labour and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Tolkunai's Group

texts.en:
Tolkunai is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a pensioner. Together with her husband, she has raised a daughter and two sons, all of whom study at school. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Tolkunai provides sewing services. She started this business six years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS. She has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. In the future, with the profits gained, she plans to purchase a new sewing machine. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old, married and blessed with three children. She has been in the quarrying business for two years. She employs two people in the business. In addition to the quarrying business, she runs a cafeteria. Previously, she was selling second-hand clothes for a living.  
Rose has benefited from the loan she previously serviced because she managed to grow her business hence improving her standard of living. She is now requesting 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy blasting materials and to employ two more people.

loans.use: to buy blasting materials and to employ two more people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 36 years old, married and has three children aged between 1 and 15 years old. He operates a tailoring services business and he specializes in making menswear. He has been in this business for 11 years now and has 5 employees. Isaiah plans to use this loan to purchase materials for making men's suits to sell. In the future, he hopes to grow his business. Isaiah describes himself as an obedient person.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make men's suits.

loans.name: Noupagagnon I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec MARIAM 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon I group are married women, on average 41 years old with 4 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Tamba, one of the towns in the district of Nantien in the Sikasso Prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to properly manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Mariam, standing all the way on the left in the photo, grows peanuts, and tiger peas. 
With this loan, she intends to pay for labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain 1 hectare of land.
The produce is sold throughout the town and at the Sikasso market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize an average profit of 50,500 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband provide for the family.
She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the best use of her farmland and generate additional income.

loans.use: To pay for labour and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.ru:
Eldaniz ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda ,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mladshim bratom. Elldaniz 24 qoda. 
Uje 3 qoda kak Eldaniz zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca.
texts.en:
Eldaniz is single and has no children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his younger brother.  Elldaniz is 24 years old.  
 
For the last three years, Eldaniz has been working as a herdsman and cattle breeder.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to expand his herd.  He started this business with his father.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy 22-year-old married woman who has been fishing for most of her life. She and her husband have many kinds of fishing tools. 

This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular customers.

Mrs. Phy and her husband support their three children who are enrolled in school. This coming fishing season, the lakes will be full of fish, but the family is lacking tools to fish with. Hence, Mrs. Phy is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment: nets and a new boat. Mrs. Phy currently lives in the province of Siem Reap.

loans.use: to buy nets and a new boat.

loans.name: Zinaida's Group

texts.en:
Zinaida is a treasurer of this group. She is 46 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and two sons. The youngest son studies at school and the other two children are in medical school. A year ago, with an initial investment of 25,000 KGS, Zinaida opened a trade place and started to sell foodstuffs. At the moment her business runs well, and she earns about 15,000 KGS (~$337) per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more foodstuffs in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future Zinaida wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Juboo du Banc Villageois de Baralé Ndiaye est créé le 17 mai 2010; il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même village,une bonne entente règne entre elles d'où le nom donné de JUBOO.La principale activité menée est le petit commerce.


Madame Dialle la responsable est âgée de 58 ans, mariée elle a dix neuf personnes en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de chaussures,elle a une bonne expérience de 5 ans; elle est debout à droite sur la photo couverte d'un châle blanc.


Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes ou bien fait confectionner les chaussures par ses grands frères et les revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de gagner plus de revenus et aussi satisfaire la clientèle.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices obtenus augmenter son épargne pour obtenir un crédit élevé et élargir son champ d'action; mais aussi de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Juboo solidarity group of the Baralé Ndiaye Village Loan Fund was created on 17 May 2010; it comprises fifteen women who live in the same village and have good relationships with each other, which is the source of the name Juboo. The main group activity is small retail business.

Ms. Dialle, the group leader, is 58 years old, married, and has nineteen people in her care. She runs a business selling shoes, and has gained solid experience over 5 years. She is standing on the right in the photo, wearing the white shawl.

She gets her supplies of shoes in the cities or has her elder brothers make them, and then re-sells them at the weekly markets. 

With her loan, she hopes to strengthen her business in order to earn more income and also satisfy her customers.

With her profits, she intends to increase her savings in order to obtain a larger loan and expand her market, as well as support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
33-year-old Alma earns a living through farming. She is married and has 3 children.

Alma has been growing rice for 5 years. She earns about 25,000 PHP (~$625) per harvest. She also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells items like sugar, vinegar and other daily use products.

Alma has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as vinegar and canned goods. She hopes to send all her children to college someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as vinegar and canned goods.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 36 years old and the single mother of five school-going children. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting.  She will sell her produce to the local market, as she is only practicing small scale farming. 

In future, Milka hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Noupagagnon Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec DITIO 1ère à droite position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon II group are married women, on average 38 years old with 4 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Tamba, one of the towns in the district of Nantien in the Sikasso Prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to properly manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Ditio, standing all the way on the right in the photo, grows peanuts and tiger peas. 
With this loan, she intends to pay for labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain 1 hectare of land.
The produce is sold throughout the town and at the Sikasso market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize an average profit of 45,500 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband provide for the family.
She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the best use of her farmland and generate additional income.

loans.use: To pay for labour and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 32 years old, married, and they have two children aged seven and three. He operates a motorcycle transport service business at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for two years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is the high cost of fuel. 

Francis plans to use this loan to purchase another motorcycle to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a fleet of motorcycles. He also has hopes of giving a quality education to his children. He describes himself as a focused person.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.  She is 39 years old, married to Peter, and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting.  

In future, Teresia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Degg Ndiggal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22juin 2010. Le groupe est  constitué de dix sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre, du thé et de l'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 22, 2010. The group is made up of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary occupation is small business.

Mrs. Awa, who is raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She also cares for two other children who were entrusted to her by their parents.

She occupies herself with the sale of sugar, tea and palm oil. She has a solid background in this line of business, as she has been practicing it for several years.

This loan will allow Mrs. Awa to strengthen her capital and to better grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea and palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more quarry land.

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 juin 2010. Le groupe est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Coura qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes et de beignet Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 22, 2010. The group is made up of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary occupation is small business.

Mrs. Coura, who is raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She also cares for five other children entrusted to her by their parents.

She occupies herself with the sale of vegetables and fritters. She has solid experience in this line of business since she has been practicing it for several years.

This loan will allow Mrs. Coura to strengthen her capital and to better grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and products for making fritters.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou, 46, is a fish seller living in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband have a fishing business. He catches fish on the lake, and she takes these fish, along with fish purchased from a wholesaler, and brings them to sell at the local market.

They have been blessed with four children who are still dependent on their incomes. Mrs. Thou has requested a loan to purchase a new motor for their fishing boat so that her husband can haul his nets more quickly and they can earn more money from their fish-catching business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor her fishing boat

loans.name: François Xavier Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est constitué de six femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leurs activités principales est le petit commerce et l'aviculture. 

Madame Jacqueline qui est à la droite de la photo en bleu avec l’écharpe blanc ou cou levant la main est  responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, scolarité etc.…) .
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on February 21, 2001. The group is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary occupations are small business and poultry farming.

Mrs. Jacqueline, who is at right in the photo, wearing blue with a white scarf at her neck, is the group's leader. She is 58 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She also takes care of four other children entrusted to her by their parents.

She occupies herself with the sale of vegetables. She has solid experience in this line of business as a result of having practiced it for several years.

This loan will allow Mrs. Jacqueline to strengthen her capital and to better grow her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, education, etc.).

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Beug Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de  solidarité Beug Diam du Banc Villageois de Baralé est composé de 29 femmes; il est créé le 17 mai 2010. Les femmes habitent le même village et font toutes du petit commerce.


Madame Khady la responsable est âgée de 25 ans, mariée sans enfant mais elle a en charge ses deux nièces; sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en robe rose bleu avec un foulard vert attaché sur sa tête.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de beignets à l'école du village,et de légumes dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle capitalise une expérience de 10 ans. 

Son prêt lui permettra de varier ses légumes (carottes,aubergines, choux,navets,poivrons...) afin de satisfaire la clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne pour pouvoir obtenir un crédit élevé, mais aussi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille surtout de sa mère.
texts.en:
The Beug Diam solidarity group belonging to the Banc Villageois in Baralé is made up of 29 women; it was set up on 17th May 2010. The women live in the same village and all have small businesses.

Khady, who is in charge of the group, is married, but although she has no children she does take care of her two nieces; she is standing on the right in the photo and is dressed in a pink and blue dress with a green scarf on her head.

She has a small business selling fritters at the village school and vegetables at the weekly markets. She has 10 years experience.

Her loan will allow her to vary her vegetables (carrots, egg plants, cabbages, turnips, peppers..) in order to satisfy customer demand and make more money.

She would like to increase her savings in order to be able to get a significant loan, but also to be able to improve her small family's living conditions, and above all her mother's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale at weekly markets

loans.name: Yeggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Yeggo du Banc Villageois de Gabar est créé depuis le 14 mai 2010,il est composé de dix huit  femmes qui habitent le même village et mènent comme activités principales le maraîchage et le petit commerce.



Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée mère de neuf enfants en charge dont un neveu;  elle fait du maraîchage et a une expérience de 20 ans; elle cultive du persil, des carottes,oignons tomates et choux.Parallèlement elle mène son petit commerce de denrées alimentaires et de ses produits récoltés. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou bleu et couverte d'un châle mauve.


Elle achéte ses semences et ses denrées dans la ville et revend au marché du village; les produits récoltés sont vendus dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter plus de semences et de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses revenus.

Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Yeggo solidarity group belonging to the Banc Villageois in Gabar was set up on 14th May 2010. It is made up of 18 women who live in the same village and whose main activities are market gardening and small-scale trading.

Awa, who is in charge of the group, is 43 years old, married and mother to nine children who are in her care, one of whom is her nephew. She has a small market garden and has 20 years experience in this domain; she grows parsley, carrots, onions, tomatoes and cabbages. At the same time she sells food products, including her own harvested produce. She is standing on the right of the photo, dressed in a blue "boubou" (an African flowing dress) covered by a mauve shawl.

She buys her seeds and food products in the town and sells them at the village market; the harvested produce is sold at the weekly markets. Her loan will allow her to buy more seeds and products in order to increase her income.

She helps her husband to provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her small market garden and food products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a shed for the cow.

loans.name: Noupagagnon Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec MARIAM 2ème à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5 hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.00FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the NOUPAGAGNON III group are married women who are on   average 38 years old and have four children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Tamba, a village in the municipality of NANTIEN, in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with the MFI, and all previous loans were correctly repaid.

They grow groundnuts and sweet peas. MARIAM, standing in the photo second from the left, will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing of about 0.5 hectare.

After harvest, the crops are sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of both men and women. Mariam expects to earn on average 35,000 FCFA per season.

This revenue will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of her farming land and bolster her profits.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010, il est composé de neuf femmes issues du même village et qui ont comme lien commun le petit commerce.

Madame Astou la responsable est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée mère d'un enfant et a en charge une nièce, son activité principale est le commerce de tissus et elle a une expérience de 25 ans; sur la photo elle est debout à droite derrière la femme assisse et habillée en wax vert.

EllE s'approvisionne dans les villes en ( wax, voile, bazin, soie....)et revend dans le village.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt augmenter les tissus afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle compte bien fructifier son capital afin de réaliser de bons bénéfices et ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille surtout pour la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar was created on May 17, 2010. It comprises nine women from the same village who have small businesses as a common tie. 

Ms. Astou, the group’s official, is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child, plus she has her niece in her care. Astou’s main business involves commerce in fabrics. She has 25 years of experience; she is the one standing at the right, behind the woman sitting down, and she is dressed in green 'wax' cloth. 

She gets her supplies (‘wax’ cloth, sheers, damask, silk...) from cities and resells them in the village. She would like to use her loan to augment her supply of fabrics in order to make much more income.

Astou really plans on making her capital grow, so as to make good profits and thus to improve her family’s living conditions, especially regarding food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to be sold

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty-three years.  He is 68 years old, married to Lucy, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. He's planning to use the milk for consumption and to sell the excess.

In future, Peter hopes to practice mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seydina  Mouhamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Seydina Mouhamed du Banc Villageois de Gabar est créé depuis le 14 mai 2010, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui habitent le même village et qui ont comme principales activités le maraîchage et l'embouche.


Madame Fatimata la responsable est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée mère de six enfants; elle fait du maraîchage et aussi de l'embouche; sur la photo elle est debout à l'extrême droit habillée en robe blanche avec un peu de bleu.


Elle achéte ses semences et produits phytosanitaires dans les villes et les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle revend les récoltes et les moutons au marché du village et dans les villages environnants.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter des moutons pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente après 4 à 5 mois d'embouche.


Avec les bénéfices obtenus elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille, elle souhaite aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Seydina Muhammad of the Gabar Village community bank was created on 14 May 2010, it consists of eighteen women living in the same village, whose main business is gardening activities and fattening. 
Fatima is the head of the group, she is 38 years of age, married and mother of six; she is gardening and also fattening, in the picture she is standing on the far right, wearing white and blue clothes. 
She buys seeds and pesticides in the city and sheep in the weekly markets. She sells crops and sheep at the village market and in the surrounding villages. 
She wants to use her loan to buy sheep to increase her herd and achieve a good revenue through the sale after four to five months of fattening. 
With the profits she will obtain she will support her husband with the family expenses and increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and livestock to raise.

loans.name: Mkutano

texts.en: Mkutano, 32 years old, married, and the father of two children aged five and one, runs a restaurant business selling food to people in the nearby industrial area. In business for 13 years and employing three people, Mkutano is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator to keep food and beverages fresh. He hopes to grow his business and eventually open other restaurants in Mombasa. He describes himself as welcoming.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Bokk Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Liggey est créé depuis le 14 mai 2010 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de Gabar; il est composé de dix huit femmes qui sont du même village et qui ont comme activités communes l'embouche et le maraîchage.

Madame Ndéye la responsable est mariée âgée de 45 ans, elle est mère de sept enfants; elle mène comme activité principale l'embouche ovine et fait en même temps du maraîchage, elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 15 ans dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite couverte avec un châle orange.

Elle achéte ses moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires et les engraisse pendant 3 à 4 mois avant d'écouler sa marchandise dans le marché hebdomadaire du village voisin.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des béliers qu'elle souhaite revendre un mois avant le recouvrement pour ainsi rembourser son prêt.


Ses bénéfices obtenus lui servent à renforcer son épargne, pour les dépenses familiales c'est son mari qui s'en charge.
texts.en:
The Bokk Liggey community group was created on the 14th of May 2010, the day the Gabar village bank was opened. The group is made up of eighteen women who are all from the same village and all rear animals and crops for a living. Madame Ndéye is the team leader, and is 45 years old, married with seven children. Her main source of income is rearing sheep, which she does alongside market gardening. She has over fifteen years' experience in this field. In the photo, she is standing on the very right hand side, wearing an orange shawl. 
She purchases her sheep from the weekly markets and fattens them for 3 or 4 months, after which she sells them in the neighbouring village's weekly market. 
This loan will enable her to purchase rams which she hopes to re-sell a month before her loan deadline, so that she can repay it. The profits that she generates from her business activities will enable her to boost her savings- her family's needs are looked after by her husband.

loans.use: to purchase rams to rear then sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, a hardworking 46-year-old single-mother of two, has been supplying wholesale food products since 2008. She also receives extra income from a pension plan that she is registered in.  Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more food products to sell such as spices and tea leaves. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her how to save her money, and within the next five years hopes to have several more business outlets.

loans.use: to buy food products such as spices and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Begg Thierno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bëgg Thierno est créé depuis le 10 décembre 2010 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de Sop Borom Darou Mousty;il est composé de onze femmes  qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toutes du petit commerce.


Madame Faty la responsable est âgée de 35 ans,elle est mariée mère d'un enfant; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de parfums et de fruits selon la saison; elle est debout sur la photo à droite est habillée en robe jaune marron et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achéte ses parfums dans une grande ville, les mangues,oranges dans le marché hebdomadaire et revend dans son quartier.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter plusieurs variétés de parfums pour satisfaire la clientèle et en même temps se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle appuie son mari avec ses bénéfices obtenus pour la nourriture et augmente aussi son épargne.
texts.en:
The Bëgg Thierno microcredit group was formed on the 10th December 2010, the same day that the Sop Borom Darou Mousty community bank was founded. The group is made up of eleven women who all live in the same quarter and are all involved in the same trade. 

Madame Faty is the group leader and is 35 years old, married with one child. She sells perfumes and fruits, depending on the season. In the photo she is standing on the right hand side, wearing a brown and yellow dress with her left hand raised. She buys her perfumes from a large nearby town, and buys mangoes and oranges from her town's weekly market, re-selling them in her quarter. 

This loan will enable her to purchase a greater variety of perfume in order to satisfy her customers' demand, as well as generating more sales. She supports her husband with the profits she generates, in order to buy food and boost their savings.

loans.use: to purchase various perfumes and fruits for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, who has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years, is 49 years old, married to Bernard, and the mother of two school children. Introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, Alice is requesting her second loan, her previous loan of Kes. 15,000 having been repaid well and in good time. She plans to use the money to buy a dairy cow to add to her herd.

In the future, Alice hopes to becoming a leading farmer, producing and selling both animal and farm produce in bulk.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.
